Welcome to Online Gaming Squared. As of today, we will be launching this page as a new page, for the OLG2 team to post basically whatever we feel will intrest our readers. Three Time, Three Time, Three Times!!!! Since his first win, no one has been able to " Squish the Fish " as Sw0rdfish once again took home top prize for the third consecutive race, and his 5th straight top three finish! Nearly matching his personal best of 33.34 (attained but a mere 5 days ago) Sw0rdfish posted a strong 33.42, 33.44, 33.44, 33.60, 33.70 with all but the last being faster then second place Dark Phoenix, who himself rose from the bottom, to gain his first ever podium finish at second with a time of 33.60. " I feel so freed " he was heard saying as he left the track With the return of the Monkey, came the return of the podium, taking a strong third at a time of 33.70. Stu was nowhere to be seen today, as he failed to crack the top 3 or to break the 34.00 second mark. Since joining the league Sw0rdish has been on a tear, winning 3/5 placing in 4/5 and simply loving it. " I can't think of anything better then driving around the track with these great guys, well.... except running around the parking lot gloating afterwards! " October the 10th @ 10:15PM is the next race for the YGKL... BE THERE!

Coldplay rocks the ACC In one of the best live performances I have EVER seen, urlLink Coldplay took the stage tonight at the Air Canada Center. The energy that this band brings to the stage is outstanding, and gets the entire building up and excited. The band plays with 150% heart, and nothing less. They put so much emotion into each and every song, and they are happier to be there, then most of the crowd. I've never left a concert thinking... "Man, that was the best 50 bucks I have spent... EVER" until tonight. If your a fan of their music, then you know what I mean when I saw they put as much passion into the songs live, as they do recorded, and if your not a fan, I strongly erge you to pick up the album A Rush of Blood to the Head and give it a spin in the old CD player, you will not be disappointed. I'm curious as to what happened when mid way thru a song, they stopped it, and Chris Martin jumped down off the stage to get involved in some altercation between some fans and security. All I saw from my 24th row seat was a bunch of badges being flashed, and someone being pushed around. If you see anything about that, post it on my boards. Cheers all, and thank you Coldplay

Taken from urlLink TSN.CA MONTREAL (CP) - Paul Tracy and Patrick Carpentier are close to signing deals with Player's Forsythe that would create an all-Canadian three-car team in CART racing next season, a spokesman said Tuesday. This would be the best thing to happen for Canada as far as CART goes, it's sad to lose the Player's team, who will have to cease sponsorship thanks to Canadian Anti-Tabaco laws following the 2003 season. However Mr. Forseythe, the team owner, assured the drivers they would have a car to drive in in the 2004 season, possible sponsor lined up for the next all-canadian team? Talk about it urlLink here!

I rarely enjoy the drive to work, it’s early, it’s cold, and no one knows how to drive!! However, this morning presented a much different experience. Traveling east on Bristol rd. I approached the lights at Confederation dr. Red. GREAT!!! So I’m sitting as all the tiny-boppers S-L-O-W-L-Y cross the road, and I notice this particular group of girls, about 16, (your thinking OMG he’s a pedophile…it’s better than that.) One of the girls is pointing, and screaming at another one, and before they reach the opposite sidewalk, still in front of my car, BAM the gloves, purses, mittens, and toques (Eh!) go flying, and it’s Ali vs. Tyson. They start wailing on each other, like red-necks in a bar fight, and then fall to the ground and continue to rumble. At this point I did what any gentleman would do… Pulled up the E-Brake, and reached for the popcorn. I couldn’t believe my eyes; they didn’t even wait till they got to the sidewalk, right in the cross-walk. A left…a right…another!! Then the instigator stood up, and started kicking the other while she was down. “Brilliant” I thought to myself. She was then pulled away by a third girl who was just standing there in shock with her jaw on the ground, a friend I assume, but only enough to get her onto the sidewalk, then they continued. At this point, public pressure (the row of cars beeping behind me) I had to continue on, but I’ve been telling the story all day, and if you ask me about it, I’ll be glad to share it again! I hope they are there again tomorrow, there’s ALWAYS a rematch!

OK.. Unreal Tournament 2K3.... Well what can I say? It's like walking trough an aquarium, and having your best friend jump out from behind a wall, and blowing your freakin head off - point blank - with a rocket launcher. It's intense, non-stop action from the second the counter reaches 0, and doesn't stop till the game ends. I'm throughly enjoying the FPS genre at the moment, between Medal of Honor, BattleField 1942, adn UT2K3, it's more than enought to take up all of my free time when it comes to gaming. Dodging, Translocating, Wall Jumping, Double Jumping, Sniping, Exploding, and calling in the Nuclear Stirke. Shooting, Scoring, Exploding, Capturing, and Holding your Position... All part of UT2K3. I can't start to explain everything in this game, but this man, urlLink Munkee , did a damn good job at explaining most of what you can do in this game. On a more local note urlLink Stu's throat is still sore, and urlLink City TV needs to put more movie inbetween each commercial.

While my hit-counter now confirms that I'm updating this for my own benifit, I'll give all you loyal Swordfish followers (Myself) some advise about HTML... When creating a link that is to open a new window, use the tag target="_blank" rather than target="new window" ...Reason: "_blank" will open a brand new window, no matter how many Internet Explorer windows are currently open, however "new window" will often use an already open IE window, and cause someone who is editing thier web-site, to lose everything they hadn't saved yet... *cough* This tip brought to you by the fine people of urlLink McDonalds.... home of the 100% Beef Burger!

The World Remembers I got this in my email at work.. Every November 11th, Canadians across the country pause in a silent moment of remembrance for the men and women who served our country during wartime. We honour those who fought for Canada - in the First World War (1914-1918), the Second World War (1939-1945) and the Korean War (1950-1953). More than 1,500,000 Canadians served overseas - more than 100,000 died. They gave their lives and their future so that we may live in peace. Today lets remember all the soilders lost fighting for our freedom, including those who have died for Operation Freedom in Khandhar.
Cool Huh?

Monday Night Racing a Success All in all last night was an over all success, fun and entertainment was had, not to mention some food and hot racer chicks! However, personally, I like Formula Kartways better, other than last week, simply because Prokarts just takes way too much time, for way too little racing! As far as the night when, Stu managed to pull out on top. He had a great second heat, great car, and it all combined to the third fastest time of the heat! However, lets not forget that Stu was lead car in the 4th and slowest second heat. While I duked it out in heat 3 and rinished a respectable second. Again, the car you ahd was a huge factor, which I guess is inevitable (Stu skips that point when he's on top) while your knowledge of the track is one thing, you need to know how to get the best performace out of specific cars. Car 8 ran well with anyone in it last night, being the winning car in almost ever heat, and car 20 and 18 made for early retirements, cars that all three of us at one point were stuck in. We're a competitve bunch, and it's hard to be competitive when your car's engine is falling out, or the acceleration is crap. I'd love to climb into 5 identical cars, and have some fun racing, but untill that happens, we will have to rely on the luck of the draw. Grats Stu on your 7th place overall finish at Monday Night Racing!

Best Buy My Ass! I could not believe my eyes and ears this morning, as we arrived at the Best Buy at Heartland to do some early morning Boxing Day shopping. Without exaggeration, at about 6:10 there were 200 people there, after grabbing a coffee, and coming back, there were probably 500, and we were at the back! Knowing that there was a draw for $1000 gift card, we stood and braved the cold, only to NOT get a raffle ticket, adn then get left out in the cold, littereally, when they stopped letting people in the store for about an hour and 45 minutes, of which we waited 30 minutes, and then gave up and went home. So... Thus begins my boycott on Heartland Best Buy, for being wimps, who couldn't walk for another 20 minutes, to hand out tickets to all the people who arrived prior to 6:45, when they were supposed to have "Random Draws." Mr. and Mrs. Best Buy are going to hear from me aswell! Anyway, I'm off now, I'll return on the 5th of January, to Blog on, untill then, stay safe, and Happy New Year! Note: urlLink The Sworded!
Oh man.... I'm still laughing. urlLink White Trash Christmas. Even if your on dial-up, it's worth the wait!

I'm gonna start off today by giving props out to myself for finishing all of my Christmas shopping in the pan of one hour, and 15 minutes. No, thats not a typo. I was in and out faster than a virgin on prom night! (Was that uncalled for? Yes I think it was). The highligh of the morning however was the present that I bought for myself. I picked up one of those Mini-RC cars, it's about 2 inches long, and a half-inch high, but it moves and handles like a dream! My cousin is getting one from a friend tonight, so I'm looking forward to setting up the track, and having a few one-on-one races tonight! The cars themselves are pretty fragile, but they are worth the 20 bucks, especially if you can line em up, 4 wide or something, it's gonna be fun. They go over almost all the flooring in my house, carpet etc... They just get a littel dusty on the wheels and you gotta clean em now and again or the allignment goes to hell. The best part of the whole deal... 45 second recharge time, THATS IT! So in essence, you can have long races, with pit stops.... Now I just need to find 30 people who own these cars, and we will be good to go! Incase I don't get a chance to come back to the site before Wednesday, which I doubt, but who know... Just want to extend my Holiday wishes to all of you, and a great 2003! If you need me, I'll be at the Erin Mills Town Centre driving around the parking lot, telling everyone I'm done!

I know I'm slacking lately, but I'm sure your all as busy as I am... between familly, and shopping, I haven't played a videogame in a week! However, I am gonna take five minutes to rant... and today's topic? Americans What the freak is wrong with them? The Metric system, get with it!!!! You arrogant bastards have to be different from the rest of the world, not realising that all your doing is making your people look different, because they don't know how big a meter is. What else?? Oh yeah, the new digital radio stuff. The entire world is using a technology called "DAB" (Digital Audio Broadcasting)... that is the entire world minus the United States, and Latvia! What does this mean to you?? Well, once you cross over into the USA, unless your radio in your car can get anallog signals as well, you will not get ANY radio, none at all. It'll be like trying to put a North American plug, into a European outlet. I'm sure there are plenty more of these that I just can't think of right now, but it's got me so mad, I'm gonna officially start up my new organisation. C.S.W. - Coallition to Standardise the World. All plugs, measurments, Television Signals, video game devices and everything, will be identical, next to th elanguage that is. Why can't I go on vacation to England, and bring my PS2?? I should be able to, and C.S.W. will make it happen dammit! Note: December 27th - January 5th, I will not be making any posts, as I will be internetless in Florida.

I had to put this out, before I went to sleep... I went to Image Comics today, to pick up my monthly Superman, JLA and other comics. On my way out, this kid asks me; "Dude, can you spare 2 bucks? I need to take the bus and I'm broke." My first reaction was Yeah Right! He's just some punk who spent his last 12 bucks on a pack of smokes (See, he was smoking). Since I had on my leather jacket, which I haven't worn since last winter, I figured I'd have little or no money in it, so I do the pocket search and come up with 3 things; 2 Used Movie Tickets from Last night A Toonie (go figure) A condom So my first reaction was, HA! Thats funny, till the kid goes and laughs hysterically and starts making cracks about the condom with his friends, then looks back at me for the toonie. So I did the best thing I could think of, gave him the comdom, threw the toonie in a sewer, and told him to go have fun with his friends ( a group of guys by the way ) and I walked off. It felt good to screw over that punk, even though it cost me a toonie, and an old condom, but no one humiliates The Fish... peace! ~Fish Out~

I'm back!!! Damn that was a kick ass movie! Mupiel n' wife, as well as my girlfriend and I all attended the midnight showing of The Two Towers and it was everything I hoped it would be... and then some! Without spoiling anything, Smeagol (Gollum) stole the show in my book. Everything that happened, I expected to happen, except for the humor that Gollum added; rivaled only by that of Gimli. I could go on for hours, really I could, since I work in 3 Hours, and going to sleep will just make tomorrow even worse. I would like you all to pay attention to one thing when you go see the film, if you haven't yet... Jackson uses a lot of fly-overs of the landscape, and some of those shots when the camera rotates 360 degrees around a character... these made me sick, to the poing I almost showed everyone my New York Fries. Famous did a shitty job of organising things, they showed the same movie in 5 theaters, but sold out the theaters one by one, so tickets for cinema 10 came out, untill it was full, and so on... Meaning that I showed up at 10:45, printed my tickets, and got cinema 10 (I bought the tickets online months ago) and then after awhile people start getting tickets for theater 7, but since noone has 7 yet, they get front of the line for that theater, and thus better seats... I could be wrong, but when I showed up, I saw one line and Mupiel says when he got there he saw many, so I'm guessing and assuming, but I'm pretty sure I'm right.. NOTE: If the above makes little sense, it's because I hardly know my own name at the moment! Spoiler for Two Towers: [Highlight to read] No Shelob... She is in the final Movie I guess. The Mother, of all Updates!!! OK... Got a beer? Some Chips... maybe a potty? You could be here awhile. Super Mario Sunshine, while a great game as far as plot, graphics, and game play go... I have never played a game such a frustrating game. Most of the levels difficulties stem from falling off some thin bridge, and starting all over again. I spent the last hour jumping to the top of some level, only to fall off at the same place every freakin time. I mean, I love the game, and I want to play it, but then after an hour of that, the game sits there for a week till I'm ready to get frustrated again. It's horrible Everquest? Still slugging it out as a newbie, trying to make ends meet and buying my spells. Tolwyn the Bard is level 13, and I'm enjoying it again, but not as addicted to it as I was when Xott was born. I remember being level 19 with Xott, sitting in the Ocean of Tears at 3am, 3 hours before I was supposed to leave for Bahamas, only to fall asleep, half packed, and my little toon sitting on a rock, in the middle of nowhere. I woke up about 5:00, in a frantic scramble to shut down the PC, pack, and get the hell outside, only to find 5 inches of snow on the ground, and 35 minutes to pick up Jen, and get to the airport. Somehow we made it... Anyway, where was I??? Oh right, Everquest. On Friday, I got my DVD Disc, for the Everquest: Online Adventures Beta III for PS2. I totally missed Beta II because I've got the DVD being shipped to Buffalo, and then to me, because they only offered the Beta to US addresses. All in all, the game is nothing compared to the PC version, mainly because you can't type unless you spend money on a USB keyboard, and why would I do that, if I can just play a better version on my PC??? I guess it's for those who can't afford PCs, and have a PS2 and a broadband connection just lying around the house? Fuxored! Some other stuff to touch on... Picked up season 1 of the South Park DVDs, and while I have enjoyed all of the South Park episodes I've seen, there are many I haven't, so for 35 bucks, a whole season of episodes I have forgotten about, it's a sweet deal! Watching it now actually, as I type! Ok before I go I wanna touch on the support clerk bit. OMG she's a bitch! You see, we have a clerk that works with us in the IT section at CCRA. Her job consists of entering our time sheets, ordering office supplies for us, and bugging the shit out of us for donations to charities. Now I'm all for giving extra money to charities, but I do it on my own time, to my own charities... She pushes us way too much, to a point where many of the IT guys just auto forward her emails to the trash! She gets involved in our shit WAY too much, and likes to complain about her son being a dickhead all the time... Which he does seem to be, needs a kick in the head or two. Another aspect of her "job" that pisses me off is her sarcastic remarks. You see, I'm late for work a lot, but when I say late, I'm talking 2 -3 minutes MAX, and this pisses her off, and naturally she says something. Now before you think "She has a point" I'll agree with you... but then she'll go and take a 2 and a half hour, to go to another CCRA site near the airport. Thing is she went because one of our other IT person, is going back to her position as a customs inspector and she needed her uniform. So our clerk decided she needed company, and went with her... why? Beats me. I could go on forever on the stupid and hypocritical things she does, but it's bad enough if she read this in the first place. Let me end this point saying that I love working there; even when it's slow and you want to bite your nails off. I just can't stand people like that, who get on their high horse about making sure I do my job, when they don't even do theirs. She's the reason we got paid a week late once... read about that urlLink here . Just want to wish my co-worker, cubical-mate, and friend urlLink | Justin, a.k.a. Mr. E 007 | a safe trip to the Philippians and remember not to flash your passport, they don't like us much right now. Merry Christmas bro, see ya in class. I urge you all to read his diary; it's pretty funny, including what happened to Lumiere at the office the other day... I just can't bear to write about it, I'm too choked up. Fish Out! ~~SwordFish~

While I'm on hockey, my blackest day as a Montreal Canadiens fan... I took this from urlLink TSN.CA ; On December 2, 1995, Roy - now the winningest goaltender in NHL history - allowed nine goals before being replaced by Pat Jablonski in an 11-1 loss to the Detroit Red Wings. After he was mercifully relieved, Roy skated back to the bench in disgust while being booed by the home fans, walked back to the box seat of team president Ronald Corey and told him, "This is my last game for Montreal." It was. Five days later, Roy was dealt to Colorado along with Canadiens captain Mike Keane for goalie Jocelyn Thibault and wingers Andrei Kovalenko and Martin Rucinsky. Now none of those players play for Montreal... sad isn't it. Peace, I’m out! ~~Fish~~

Distance travelled...150 Feet. Ok it's cold, but thats fucking nuts! If the kids all get out about 10 feet from Bell Harbour, then the most either of them has to walk to get back to their current stop, is like 75 feet.. And parents wonder why kids are getting fat? Give me the millions your spending on research, and I'll give you an answer. They're lazy punks who are babied till they are 17, at which point they buy a car and end up not being able to run from here to there without fainting. Am I in great shape? no. Can I run for 5 minutes without complaining I'm gonna pass out. YES! For the record, the bus stopped 2 more times between Bell Harbour & Thomas and my house, about 500 meters. **sigh** Anyway... Now, it's back to Dereth, to emerse myself in fantasy lands and goblins that bite! Yeowch

What a weekend! Culminated with the purchase of my next endeavour... Asheron's Call 2: Fallen Kings. While I've only just scratched the surface of the game, I'm hooked to it like Crack. When compared to my reaction to Everquest, it's equal. I'm really impressed with this game, especially when you turn on all the effects. it's jaw dropping goodness, all the way to the waving blades of grass, and your feet disappearing into the knee high areas of it. It uses an attack system similar to DAOC where you have simple one click attacking, in combination with special effects, attacks, and defences that you trigger by using hotkeys. As for it's guild system, it referred to as an allegiance, and it's rather unique. Here's a quick overview. While your walking the world, you simply invite people to swear allegiance to you. Once someone has sworn to you, they are in your Monarchy, in which any XP they acquire, trickles down to you, and then on to whomever you swore to, and so on, and so on. Logging in to 7000 XP points that you acquired while you were sleeping, is common! I'm not sure what happens when you leave the allegiance, but I'm assuming the people under you, just become Vassals to the person you had swore to. Three races, a little low, but more than enough ways to shape your character. Strong " Missile " skills (That's ranged attacks), a mix of Missile and Melee, etc.. It's all up to you. Best part being that if you go up one ladder, and change your mind... NO Problem! untrain all your skills, and get everything you spent on them back. So go from a Melee, to a Missile in a short time, instead of having to start 2nd characters, and re-levelling them! So I'll stop there as far as AC2 goes, but suffice it to say, it's well worth the investment if your into MMOGs in particular Fantasy based ones. Ok time to rant... Where should we start today? Microsoft and their " Software Assurance ...Geeks sitting at home, making viruses, to make our lives hell?.. or the piece of trash they called Computer Fest at the International Center. It was horrible! But you know what.... I can't handle these morons right now, I'll take action and rant later... right now... I'm so mad, I can SPIT! A Plus from the Computer Fest urlLink

Holy Shit! There's a game in that box I think its time I step back, look at the cornucopia of PC-CD boxes above my head, and say "I'm gonna sit in this chair, and not move untill I beat all of those games!" Unfortunately, school and work get in the way of spending about 50 hours with my ass stuck to this chair. Naturally I'd have to get up to use the washroom and get food when no one is home to bring it up to me... but meh! Just details! Ok, in all seriousness, I've been carrying around the list of incomplete games I own on my Palm for about 3 months now, and it's getting me nowhere, so I'm going to publicly post what they are, and then make a nice little table, and stick it where that poll is, and then it will be a constant reminder of what a game slacker I am... Make that Slamer, (Slay-mher) Get it... Gamer... Slacker... I kill myself! (Just laugh you'll live longer and feel happier) The List... Combat Flight Simulator 3 Unreal Tournament 2003 The Sims.... Get Past the getting a job part w/o cheating Freedom Force Medal of Honor:Allied Assult Medal of Honor:Spearhead Battlefield 1942 NHL 2002 - Been in Conference Finals for 4 months... Lord of The Rings: The Two Towers (PS2) Lets say, 3 months... 3 months to see the credits on all these games! I'm confident I can do it. I just need developers to stop cranking out games, and adding to the freakin pile! Now before I go to sleep so I can wake up and finish studying for this test... I found a great Hockey Manager. It plays much like NHL 2002, minus the graphics, the controlling the players, the scoring, the motion videos, the crowd, the control-pad. Ok so al you get to do is decide who plays, who doesn't, who's making how much, who to trade, who to sign, who to bench and all the fun stuff that NHL GMs and Coaches get to do! And it's totally free! Mind you it's a little outdated, but the programers got signed by a company to produce an actual version of the game for Sports Interactive, the creators of Championship Manager. urlLink http://eastside.peliplaneetta.net/ - Get the Game here - Download the 1.16 version, then the patch. Then go to downloads and get the Rosterpak and your good to go. If you want to read up on Sports Interactive, go urlLink here! ~sw0rdfish~

OK... I'm so tired; I could fall asleep listening to a cat cat-a-wall, while someone drags their fingernails across a chalk board! So the solution? Go to bed! Which is exactly what I plan on doing in the next 20 minutes or so. First, remember this picture!? Well, did you notice the two cat's sitting in the background going " What they hell is that freak doing now? " Well, in case you still don't see them, let me introduce to you, my night vision Ellipse Tool from Photoshop, and WHAM! Kitties appear! if you look back in the first picture, you just see their pointy eyes, but with the night vision on, Simon and Kasey, front and center! You’re busted! Thanks to Amanda, for pointing this out! I thought it was funny! Ok, on to things you may actually care about! Games? I got none! plus I've been way too tired to download any, but let me ask you this. How many of you have played Battlefield 1942? Now, how many of you have played the multiplayer?... I see... But! Did you use MSN, or Roger Wilco and hook up mics and talk to the people your playing with? This is a whole new game! Variation and I had a blast hooking up the headsets, and shooting down some Japanese scum, or US scum, depending on whether we felt in the mood for war-crazy and overweight, or smart and high tech. Don't get it? Don't worry, its not that funny! Well, the comments we had going back and forth were pure jokes! Like when we hopped in a transport, and I radioed to Var; " Plane on our 3.." "Yeah, I see it!!" - Unloads a round of Machine gun ammo at the plane "Did you get it? I ask" "Don't think so" - This is when we notice that we have water up to our heads "Uh Var... I think we're gonna die" "yup.. we're dead" You gotta use your imagination, but if you have played the game, and haven't tried with the headset, I recommend you do! It's a laugh a minute. From transports, to scout and artillery to Pilot and read gunner, we had a blast.. . Especially when Var would try to bail out, and the exact point I'd pull up, and I'd end up killing him with the propellers... Or when he bailed out, w/o telling me, and I'm left stuck in the rear gunner seat of the plane, wondering why the green side is up, and approaching fast. It brought a whole new dimension to the game I had shelved for a while, and now has a permanent place back in my CD Rom drive, at least for when someone with a headset is ready to rock! "It's all about the Jeep" "What are you talking about?" - Var notices me driving up Omaha Beach in a jeep - "RAMBO!!!!!!"

Pleh! Felt like I just closed my eyes to go to bed, and I'm up again! There really isn't any reason for me to blog, other than the fact that I don't want to be up right now! Use MSN messenger, adn text message me what you want if you don't know my number, and I'll have it for you in class. First 3 people only, just because I don't want to buy every Tom, Dick and Harry a bloddy bagel! (Like anyone reads this page at all, let alone before 7:30AM!)

Super… OK maybe not super, but it was alright! One thing I gotta talk about is the fact that Shania Twain sucks! Halftime show at both CFL and NFL championship games, and she lip syncs!!?? We’re a hockey country! OK grant it hockey has 7 games, and could end at any game, so lets get together for all 7 games!! I’m up for it! In fact, I’m inviting everyone over this year for the Stanley Cup Finals, all 7 games (“if necessary”) and we’ll eat junk, drink beers and pop, and bet on everything we possibly can, including who is gonna dump the puck first, who’s gonna land the first big hit, and which goalie is going to take a sip of water first! I’m going to enjoy this playoff run during the second half of the season, and I have a feeling, just a feeling, that the Habs can make the top 6 this year! Good luck boys! For those who don’t know Kimmel is the dude who read the questions on Win Ben Stien’s Money and co-host of The Man Show . ~Fish Out~ P.S. Shania you’re a sellout! Not sure why I’m so mad about that, but its bullshit! P.P.S. Computer freaked on me, it's 1:00 and I'm going to bed now! Still no Coldplay!

From MSNBC:M Many Internet users experienced a sharp slowdown in traffic during Saturday’s early morning hours, as a fast-spreading Internet worm overwhelmed the world’s digital pipelines. The worm, which is being called both “Slammer” and “Sapphire” doesn’t attack typical home computers — instead it attacks machines running database software from Microsoft called SQL Server. The worst of the attack seems over, experts said, but groggy-eyed Internet workers were spending the day Saturday cleaning up from the effects of the outbreak. urlLink Complete Story In more local news... The Tim Horton's cup fiasco is solved. Let me back up a step or two. On Monday, I stroll into class all badass like with my new Tim Horton's travel mug. I stopped to talk to Kelvin, then proceeded to pour my coffee onto his work! The stupid lid just pops off, and you can't use the cup! That is, untill today!! Tim Hortons has issued a recall on all the lids for their stainless steal travel mug. Seems they mysteriously " pop-off ." yeah, No Shit! Fish Out!

Apparently that bug that I spoke of earlier, with the My Sims, is as a direct result of the Bonus Transportation CD, and the My Sims feature together. I found this on a page, I forget where... The crash with MySim is related to the bonus CD. If you have installed the bonus CD and have moved a MySim into your city, crashes are likely. We will have a patch available soon that fixes this issue. Deleting the file called Plugin_007_AirForceBase.dat from the Plugins directory found in Program Files\Maxis\SimCity 4\Plugins is a quick way to avoid the crash. Fate, Love and Everquest I know I've updated three times tonight, but I couldn't help this one. If you've heard the name Everquest you probably relate it to one of two things... The MMOG the changed the way Online Gaming is done, the computer world's version of Crack; ending marriages, spawning support groups, and even the blame of one person's death. I've been playing now for well over 2 years, actually, I think its 3 now, but that’s not the point. In three years I've heard lots of love stories come out of this game, and really, i thought nothing much of it... it happens right? However, this one instance, floored me, and it might do the same to you. I logged in to get an hour of soloing time in, before I called it a night. So I head to my usual spot, Lava Storm, and as usual, I'm the only one there. After about 10 minutes I'm joined by a funny looking gnome, who sits beside me and offers to group up, and smash some baddies together. Who can't use company right? So the usual chatter takes place, and we got on to the subject of expensive months of the year. When we spend the most, and he mentions that this year, June wins hands down, so naturally I joked, Your Getting Married.... or Divorced. He says marriage, and when I asked how they met, I got an answer I never expected. Turns out he dated said girl in high school for about 4 years until she moved 2000 miles away for college. After about a year and a half of the long-term deal, they mutually decided it was better to go their own ways, the distance just made it too hard, and after about another 2 months they stopped speaking to each other completely. So feeling alone, and down he gets into Everquest, and after about a year of playing, he becomes great friends with a girl from his guild. They did everything together, and after about 6 months of this... you guessed it he starts to really dig this chick, and decides that he's gonna say something. Take note that this is all online, I'm thinking at this point, this guy is nuts! So he continues... and they have the talk one night out in the very spot that we were sitting, and she feels the same way, based only on playing a game and learning the person's personality game wise, they are nuts for each other. That’s when the talk gets nuts, for the first time he asks her, feeling kinda silly that he just spilled his guts to her... So anyway, what’s your real name? And wouldn't you know it. IT’S THE SAME GIRL HE WAS DATING IN SCHOOL!!!!! Turns out she changed to another school, and all he knew about the person behind the character was that she was going to school in Florida, and that she started playing Everquest after she moved to Florida. I asked how the hell he never knew more about her, and he says she was really reserved in the guild, never said much about real life, and just loved talking about the game, and about life, but never her own! I mean, this guy could have been pulling my leg, but then why? Why would you make something like that up? It's just way too weird! I'll chalk that one up as fate doing its thing, but man, what a weird way to work out! The odds of this have to be astronomical, without speaking for about a year and a half, to meet up in the world of Norrath, and end up back as Junior in high school... well that’s just way to much for me. It's a small world after all...

4-6, 7-6 (5), 4-6, 6-4, 21-19 I know what you’re thinking... "Those sorta look like Tennis scores, except those last 2 numbers... What the hell is that" Well..., it IS tennis scores! Scores you get after a 2h:23m 5th set and a 4h:59m game that saw it's final set go 40 games. They even let the ball boys play a few points. You can read about it urlLink here. That was definitely worth mentioning. Now, to gaming... I woke up this morning to the sound of my doorbell ringing, and a Canada Post employee handing me my copy of The Sims: Unleashed . I know it's been out a really long time, but there was just so much more I wanted to try, and I was happy with Vacation so I was in no rush to pick up Unleashed . So what’s new with Unleashed? Quite a bit actually, they have expanded the neighbourhoods to something like 40 Lots, giving you more places to create neighbours and such. As well as allowing you to create local commercial places such as shops, restaurants and hangouts that you can then visit and purchase from. The usual updates are there as well, the best of thesims.com, patches, new social animations, and of course... The newest feature, the pets! I like it so far, other than the fact that it seems like my lot has become a haven for unwanted pets. I swear there are like cats and dogs fighting all over my property, you know that clay-mation film of Rudolph the Red Nose Reindeer? Toy island where all the misfits go? That’s my house! Except it's for all the unwanted pets! They are all over the freakin place, and if you pet them... you’re screwed! They follow you around till you shoo them off, and then you feel bad cuz they're so damn cute! In the end pets just take your Simolians, and boost your social aspect, which is good since I tend to get annoyed with my neighbours because they take every attempt to feel them up as a bad thing, and I lose like 50 friendship points... but that’s another story :) Overall I'm please with the purchase, and if you’re a Sims fan, then we have yet another must from Maxis! Check it out at urlLink www.thesims.com . Before I move on, I hear "The Sims Online" is like Everquest minus the adventuring and the monsters... trade skills and chatting... believe me, after 2 years of Everquest, I hate trade skills, so I hope there is more to it. In other news, looks like Dawson's Creek is about to kill off another character... and I can't be more thrilled, show needs a bit of drama. Oddly enough, Dawson wasn't even on Dawson's Creek this episode... **shrug** Anyone else notice I use "..." way too much? I think I'm done for now, I was going to mention something else, but it's gone from my mind, and after staring blankly at the screen for five minutes, my eyes hurt, so I'm giving up! ~~Fish~~

First let me start off by saying that I feel, now more than ever that I update this site for myself. In three days I have gotten 3 answers to my poll, which tells me of the 20 hits, only 3 people were here cuz they had something to read..... I cried about this, a lot... I'm not lying! Anyway, I'll carry on like the soilder that I am... Speaking of Soilders, I'd like to get political for a second but I'll post these cool pics of my room cleaning evening on Monday night. Took me till 4AM, just to clean the frocking desk! urlLink click here!!! - Warning Bandwidth Challenged Need Not Apply! Now, back to being political... I've been following the Friendly Fire incident in Kandhar very carefully, especially since the hearing started. At first I thought, these guys should never fly again, nor should they ever be allowed to serve their country abroad anymore. (If they want to let them kill Americans, then thats not my business) and just be removed from the USAF. However, since then I've been given some new information, and I share The Pilots were flying at 23,000 feet Semi Automatic weapons were being used by the Canadians on the ground at the time Seme Automatic weapons ricochette does not go anywhere close to 23,000 feet It took 2 minutes to get info to the pilots that the people on the ground were friendlies 2 Minutes for that sort of information is not unusual Pilots have to give the coordinates of where they are before dropping a bomb No coordinates were given All US bombs that are dropped need to have authorisation from Saudi Arabia No Authorisation was given So where does this leave us? A Pilot in an F16 who could have easily left the area, and waited for authorization, before returning to drop the bomb if neccessary. No authorisation, totally ignored all protocals for this situation and 4 dead soilders... Now "heat of the moment" and "they were on drugs issued by the USAF" are cop-outs because the USAF has been doing this for years, and these pilots are trained for combat. I think Schmidt should spend the rest of his life in jail, for the simple fact that he killed 4 people, while NOT following protocal, and claiming that machine gun ricochette was Artillary aimed at him some 20,000 feet away. Maybe jail is too harsh, but then again... those Canadians paid with their lives, to train... I'm not usually this forward about these subjects, because I don't know whats it's like to be 23,000 feet up, or in an F16 for that matter... However people who have are claiming that they should have known the differences, and there was no way they were in danger... These guys are supposed to be the best in the world, and there is no way the best in the world should be skipping protocals and stuff like that.
Take a Second to answer my poll please, and if it's not to much to ask, be honest! Thanks, Fish Out~

Afternoon fun with power supplies!! I got home from school with a plan to do one thing. Ok, well 2 things EQ and Sim City 4. So I sit down on my comfy gaming chair when suddenly I notice this smell... Kinda tangy kinda not, then POOF! computer shuts down, and I'm wondering WTF just happened, then it hits me. Not tang... burning electronics! GAaH! My computer is FUBAR! So like any other geek, I jump in my car, and it's off to CompuSolutionsDepot for a new power supply! Picked up a can of compressed air while I was there, give the fans a blow job! :o) Upon getting everything back up and running, I decided, again like a typical geek, to do one of those "turn you keyboard upside-down and see what falls out" and OMG!! That was the most disgusting thing I had ever seen! Staples, dust, bleech-blond hair (Gee where did that come from) and even 2 tabs from a Pepsi Can... Well, I wasn't satisfied, so i ripped off every damn key, and gave the keyboard a blow also! MUaH! Spottles, now the not so fun task of getting the keys back in the right spot! 102 out of 104, I mixed up the Scroll Lock and the Pause/Break but who uses those keys anyway! I made my way thru the Penny Arcade archives some more, just because they are a good laugh, so I'm gonna link to a few of the funnier ones! urlLink Duh! urlLink Say what? My kingdom to the person who figures out what the hell that symbol is! urlLink I forget, but it made me laugh Now back to terrorizing the people of Aberville, I'm about to be impeached, lets see if I can rebound! Julien's First Win, Habs 3 Panthers 2 - Habs are actually outshooting teams! Lets remeber Martin Luther King Jr. Today!

Sweeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeet!! No, I'm not talking about the Leaf's win over the Habs, I've decided I'm not going to discuss this today! We got one point, and at this part of the season, I'll take anythign we can get. I'm looking forward to the second half of the season. The new coach Julien seems to have a good relationship with Marcel Hossa, and Marius Czerkawski... 2 Players I know can and will step up their game, and stick around for many years in a Canadiens jersey, (I hope). Now, back to sweetness! Sim City 4 is the ultimate, if you don't have it, and your a Simmer like me... then go get it! Stop reading my non-sense, ask mommy and daddy to drive you to the mall, use that money you saved from mowin Mrs. Handready's lawn, and buy this freakin game!! Yes it needs a patch or two to clean up some bugs (I can't import Sims from The Sims , or it crashes. No clue why!) but it's so much fun! They use the same features that are available in The Sims where you can have Sims from one house interact with another... Well in SC4 (I'm tired of typing Sim City 4) you can interact with neighbouring cities. Share power, water, job locations. So in effect, you can build one city 95% residential, another one right beside it 95% industrial. Throw in some commercial, and boom! Your set. The pollution will overflow, as will traffic and so on, so you can't cheat and ignore the other things in one city. (IE If the traffic in the industrial city is crap, then the sims in the residential city will complain that their commute is too long, and move out!) I could go on forever about the fun stuff you can do with this game, including but not limited to driving a big ass tornado right thru the house of the bitch who keeps complaining that her son has too far to go for school! Funny story, I decided my first city was built piss poorley (don't build near edges, it sucks), and wanted to start over so instead of hitting the "Obliterate City" button, I pulled out God Mode, and started landing meteors all over the place, the people were running and screaming all over the place, that is till I pulled out the Lightning feature, and grilled them! There is a news ticker that runs while your playing. Tells you whats up, who's pissed off at you, who needs more money, advisors telling you what you should do, who wants to have your baby... You know all that usefull information. Well this one had me in stiches... "Locals name child "Boody Doody Ba Da Do Do Ding"; He Sues" I tell ya, nothing better than a game with a sense of humor! Now, before I shut up about this, there is one more thing I want to touch on quickly. In the near future EA is goign to let you create regions online, in which you can mayor your own city (Can I use mayor like a verb??) and collaborate with other SC4 users much in the same way you can with your own cities offline! It's not up yet, so I can't test it out, but I'll let you know. I also got this Transportation CD from EB when I bought it, I'm not sure exactly what it does because when I installed it, the game looked exactly the same, but I'll get back to you all on that also! Overall, we got an 8/10 game here, with a must buy tag from me!! (Buy it from EB to get the extra CD) My City!! ~~Fish Out~~

Time for another SwordFish approved time waster! While it's not the game of the year or nothing, it's a fun competition type game to play with your friends. Aim for the highest score. urlLink Free Lunch Design has developed a fun game called Icy Tower . You a little homie, and you just jump from level to level trying to get the highest score you can, or the heighest floor that you can reach. Currently my highest is 3797 at Floor 196. I have been known to reach the 250 mark in floors, however, combos are the way to go. If you jump over at least one floor you have started a combo, do this consecutivley, and the number of floors will continute to count, and your points are even higher for that jump. Jump one floor at a time, and you'd have to reach floor 380 to beat me! It's worth the download, the music is fun too. You can download a modified sound file, but it's not necessary, unless you really like the music, in which case I'll keep you up to date on upcomming Soundtrack CD releases.

Got a few things to discuss this here fine evening. Maybe even a rant or two! Links 2003! - MMM Gaming goodness! I played a demo of the game that came in last month's urlLink PC Gamer and man was it a bowl of fun. They have developed a new " Real Time Swing " for the game. What this means is the golfer is actually swinging, as you move the mouse. You control club head speed, angle of contact, and follow thru all with the way you move the mouse! It's awesome!!! The conventional Click! Click! Click! method is still available, should you wimp out. And you could always line your mouse up beside a straight wall or somethign to ensure you swing straight, but thats just not fun! The demo had Sergio Garcia avatar on it. Gives little wise cracks and what-not when you shank one, in pure Sergio Garcia accent! It only had 9 Holes on the demo, but the game has 7 courses I think, and the Links courses always get release shortly after, if you want to play more, you can... or make you own using the included Arnold Palmer course designer (not sure how that helps you, maybe they give you his thought process while you build! **shrugs** Anyway, I'm gonna pick this one up, as soon as I get my last paycheck from CCRA, I mean " My Employer " DON'T LEAVE! There is More!!! What more can I possibly have to say? Besides asking why McDonalds employees translate "Only Lettuce" to "Overflow my sandwhich with lettuce so I don't taste the chicken please." Well, I think it's time I explain my side project ( What?? A Side Project to something that has like 3 readers??? Oh well ) called Fish Inc. What is Fish Inc you ask? Well it's another blog silly! Only it's going to be multi-user and will hopefully include all of the Mississauga/Brampton bloggers that I know, and a few knew ones *cough* Mupiel *cough*. We'll shoot the shit on the web page, talk about whatever (Not Porn, you guys can keep that on your own Blogs) and hopefully just have an all round good time and let others read it. Who knows, we may say something smart! Wanna write on Fish Inc, let me know! It's just another thing to waste time. I'm gonna prep the Blog over the next few days, and find somewhere to host it... maybe Stu's ISP or something?? Even if he doesn't want in! By the way, I got some bottle rockets I brought back from Florida, we'll have to get a digital cam, a lighter, and some shit to explode, and go out and get some cool pics oui? Thats It!!! The story of me, and my online names... I'm tired of everyone saying that my name is from a movie... it's not! For those of you who don't know this, my grandfather was a pilot in the Royal Canadian Air Force. When I turned 7, he gave me a collection of aircraft cards. He showed me all sorts of neat planes. The Canadian plane, that came in the mail (The cards came every week) was urlLink The Swordfish. I started using that alias for video games, laser tag, and anything that they would let me use that many letters, alternatley I used JAG (His Call name in the air, since his initials were JAG, not that stupid show). When he passed away while I was in grade 11 I lost his dog tags and I hung up the name.. I just didn't like the reminder. Untill recently when I sold my Everquest account, I was using my EQ name, but that went away with the game, and so I ressurected the best name I've ever used, in honor of my grandfather and Canada. The Swordfish was a two-place torpedo bomber used during the Second World War. Although seemingly antiquated in comparison to the Spitfire or Hurricane, the Swordfish gave a good account of itself in several battles, including the sinking of the German battleship Bismark and the raid on the Italian port of Taranto For intrests sake, I'm going to recap my aliases.. Swordfish BootLegger23 The Edge RaVeN Xott Sw0rdFish (Why zero, instead of O... That damn move made everyone take the damn name!) So there you have it... do you care? Proably not... but read it you shall! (Or did) ~~So it is Written, And So Shall it Come to Pass... Maybe~~ ~~Quote the Swordfish evermore!~~ That was a signature experiment... Prolly wont last

So I tried to get as close as I could, and BAM I thought I had it nailed, and then the computer forced the sales associate to give me a Best Buy Gift Card for the amount of 2 cents (Shown Below)... Gotta love technology! Naturally, my generosity got the best of me, and I have decided to raffle off the gift card to the person who can correctly identify the number of jelly beans sitting on my desk, that are lined up length-wise running north south. Good luck to you all! Send entries to my e-mail account :) More pictures to come soon, since my step-dad got a Digital Camera, I'm going picture happy!

Entertainment Weekly) -- 2002 was the year that the celebrity mea culpa became an art form. In fact, Whitney Houston's recent interview with Diane Sawyer provided enough classic excuses to fill a top-10 list all by itself. However, we didn't want to shortchange the creativity, ingenuity, and chutzpah of the many worthy stars who spent so much of the year explaining away their misdeeds. So, in that giving spirit, EW.com offers the 10 best celebrity excuses of the year: 10) ''I've killed enough of the world's trees.'' -- Stephen King, on his planned retirement from publishing 9) ''People think it's s---.'' -- Guy Ritchie, telling Oxford students why his ''Swept Away,'' starring wife Madonna, is going straight to video in England 8) ''Tom Sizemore is a popular and nice guy. An individual became unruly when asked to leave and was escorted out of Mr. Sizemore's house. Subsequently, the individual asked me, Mr. Sizemore's attorney, for money. This is a shakedown and we are confident that it will go away.'' -- Robert Barta, attorney for Tom Sizemore, on the actor's misdemeanor battery charge for allegedly assaulting a woman claiming to be his fiancee 7) ''All I needed was, like, five hours' sleep.'' -- Mariah Carey, on her hospitalization for ''exhaustion'' last year 6) ''All I know is, I woke up and I am covered in cream.'' -- R.E.M.'s Peter Buck, testifying that he couldn't remember an alleged air-rage incident in which he was accused of overturning a breakfast cart, because of a blackout he blamed on a drink and a sleeping pill taken on an empty stomach; he was ultimately acquitted 5) ''Sometimes when I'm sleeping, you know, it's, like, in the middle of the night I'm not, like, totally clear. I'm thinking I'm sleeping with my wife.... I'm not even attracted to you! I am 150 to 200 percent happy with the wife that I have.'' -- ''Survivor: Thailand'' castaway Ted Rogers Jr., apologizing to tribemate Ghandia Johnson, in response to her accusation that he was ''grinding'' against her in her sleep 4) ''It was the goal of these people to eliminate me. This business would have worked except for these five or six guys. They wanted to kill Michael Ovitz. If they could have taken my wife and kids, they would have.'' -- Former Hollywood power broker Michael Ovitz, blaming his fall from grace on what he called the industry's ''gay mafia'' 3) ''Crack is cheap. I make too much money to use crack. Crack is wack.'' -- Whitney Houston, on why crack was absent from the otherwise lengthy list of drugs she admitted to having used 2) ''I made a terrible mistake. I got caught up in the excitement of the moment. I would never intentionally endanger the lives of my children.'' -- Michael Jackson, apologizing for dangling his baby outside a Berlin hotel window, several stories above a crowd of fans on the street 1) ''I was told that I should shoplift. The director said I should try it out.'' -- Saks Fifth Avenue guard Colleen Rainey, testifying during Winona Ryder's trial, quoting the actress' explanation that she was preparing for a movie role Taken from urlLink CNN.COM

MSN is down, school is back on, and Pizza Pizza no longer accepts slice cards! What is the world coming to? First off, Pizza Pizza. I went to get a slice of pizza for lunch, only to be told, "Sorry, we don't stamp the cards any more!" So with my natural sarcastic tone, I say What if I had 9? . To which she replies "He Had 10!" While pointing to a man sitting there, eating a slice! This guy had bought 10 slices of pizza, and was owed a Free Slice, and they wouldn't honor the card!!! Then the dumbass PAYS for a slice anyway! I would have been on the phone with everyone including the president of Pizza Pizza, untill I got my free slice! I just looked at the guy, looked at the manager of the store, and laughed! I only had 2 stamps, so I didn't care that much, but still, pulling an HMV is NOT cool. Sheridan's attempt to include Red Hat's Linux in the laptops has failed miserably so far, maybe they will fix it, but I doubt it. Note: Pulling an HMV, is having higher prices, and offering free CDs after 10, to make it worth paying more, and then removing your reward program, while keeping your prices high.

Home Sweet Home I'm back, na na na na na na na na na! Just under 4 hours from the Corel Centre to my front door, actually I was about 2 KM from the Corel Centre, but whatever. After last night two things are clear... Coldplay fucking rocks live, and I now understand why no one goes to the Senator's games! The staff at that place doesn't know their ass from their elbow. Getting to the floor the first time was hard enough, but god forbid you want to use an ATM, conveniently places outside the gates, and of course none of the concession stands take interac. So we're back outside the gates, and I figure I can just walk back down any isle, and get back onto the floor, that must be why they gave us these nifty bracelets... WRoNg! All the way back down the way we cam, half way around the arena, down more steps, and around another 2 corners, [past an ATM that no one apparently knew was there, or just wanted to get a kick out of my walk] simply to end up on the floor [basically on the ice] at the bottom of the aisle I was just standing at the top of before they made me do all that walking. I know, I've confused you... well thats how fucked up that place was! The Music opened for Coldplay , and they were really loud, and outgoing. It was ok, but it didn't jive well with Coldplay 's sound. Chris Martin, [the lead singer of CP] did his best to speak french to the crowd, was actually pretty funny, and the music was unreal, as was the energy. Look at me thinking I'm a music reviewer... No gaming to speak of, sorry. Metroid Prime continues to kick ass! I installed some IE-Spell software, so if there are spelling mistakes, blame urlLink [ Stu ] Peace!
Ottawa... brrrrr I'm out in Ottawa, and it's freakin cold! The room has internet, so if anything cool happens, you'll hear about it here! ~Fish Out~

Can I Return This Please? Of course I'm talking about the 25cm of snow that fell last night! What the hell was that? Being a corner house we had about 30-35cm of snow on parts of our driveway! Nutz! Actually I was refering to three things with that title [now thats making the most of your title!]. Starting on Februrary 15th, EB Games a.k.a. Electronic Boutique, is no longer taking returns on games unless they are defective, in which case you can only change it for the same title. This is something that every other store has been doing for a long time, and EB went on and off with it over the past 2 years. Now thanks to some people who abuse the system, and use EB as a rental shop because they are too fucking cheap to go to Blockbuster and pay, it's gone... and frankly I'm dissapointed. It used to let me buy games without fear and on the two occasions that I hated the game, I returned it. I guess I'll have to look into stuff more before I buy it. This brings me to the third meaning of the title. I returned Generals yesterday, it was just too buggy and when I actually connected, it was like ever other RTS I've played, either "the rush" kills you in 3 minutes, or you run into some loser who has to use cheats and makes a HUGE army in about a minute and a half. So I picked up Metroid Prime for my neglected GameCube, and I honestly love this game. It brings back those old feelings of Metroid on the NES, only in a first-person-like perspective. I can't get into it too much since I only finshed 5%, but the controls are great, just take time to get used to it. I'll hit on it next time I blog, after I get more time on it. All that being said, I'm heading to Ottawa tomorrow for the Coldplay concert, so don't expect anything new untill I get back Tuesday night. Incase any Montreal Canadien reads this page... WHAT HAPPENED? You had them! :o( - Lets get some points and get them in the playoffs!

As Promised Well, I'm going to post those screenies from the opening of Medal of Honor: Spearhead. This is part of the playable game, not a Full Motion Video or anything like that. Also as promised, I completed the game. It didn't take very long, was only about 9 levels, 3 missions. Mind you the levels were pretty long, and the missions were great. Not like the first set of missions, this one was an all out offensive, and your in the troops. None of this behind enemy lines crap. Your on the front line, taking the Krauts head on, and it hurts... a lot! Especially after you take a few panzer shots to the head, point blank. If you've played the MoH series you know that Allied Assault takes a page or two out of "Saving Private Ryan" , the expansion deffinatley takes a page out of Band of Brothers but does it well, and there is no way you'll catch me complaining about it. For 30 Bucks, this expansion was awesome, and thats just the Single Player. The Multiplayer maps, as previously mentioned, are awesome as well. urlLink urlLink urlLink Click on one of them to see super sized! The pane getting destroyed is the one I just jumped out of... some of my squadmates weren't so lucky. I wanted to add, some of the monologues that go on during the mission recaps are pretty touching... real poems by soilders on the battlefield. ~FISH I.N.C~

Demoralised What a harsh way to tell somone that they're not good enough. As you may or may not know, I consider myself the most rechable person I know. If you can't get me on email, then MSN, or text messaging, call me, whatever. Anyway, I go to check my email before class, and WHAMO! 6, count em, SIX rejection letters for employment at RIM Technologies. So I think to myself, "Ouch... That stung, no worries, you applied for 6 others" then after finishing reading the 6 letters, I hit F5 to download any new ones, and 2 more come thru. So thats 8 in about 3 minutes. I'm still licking my wounds. I mean, I've been rejected for jobs before, but 8 in 3 miuntes just hurts... None the less, I go on. No one keeps me down long! urlLink [ Mupiel ] and I, smoked our way thru about 1/3rd of Medal of Honor: Spearhead last night after class, and the first sceen after jumping out of an airplane, we both sat there with our jaws to the desk as AA fire missed us and hit planes above us, below us and basically all around. It was probbaly the best opening sequence I have seen in... well... ever!
w00y Happy Day Variation!!!

Still a Bad Buy! urlLink [This Issue] is still unresolved. The manager called me on the 24th of January, but I was " indisposed " [ read:I was on the can ] and decided not to answer the call, however had I know what would follow I would have. He left a message saying he would call back, and he still hasn't. I got sick of waiting and emailed them back, and they told me [ as if I didn't know what I have done and not done ] that he called me back, appologised, and he had given me a gift card for my inconvenience. Since none of that had happened, I freaked! First look at the way they write it, as if I'm making this shit up? You were contacted and the issue was discussed with You. The store offered to provide a Gift Card to you for your inconvienience by the Manager Rudy Irish on the 24 January, 2003. Please give us some details. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. We would like to thank you for shopping at Best Buy Canada. Should you have further questions or concerns, please feel free to contact us by phone at 1-866-237-8289 or email us at customerservice@bestbuycanada.ca. Sincerely, Dick Customer Care Best Buy Canada Umm.. . No Dick, I wasn't contacted. It just irks me the way they tell me what happened to myself? How about if I called you tomorrow Dick and said "You woke up with a strange desire to have sex with a male, and then proceeded to give all your money to me." You moron! At least say that "Our records show" or something like that! Anyway, moving on. I called the phone number because I had enough of these idiots, and I ended up getting the Regional Manager's phone number. So she's gonna hear from me, not about the original incident, but the incompetence of her employees and their shitty customer service skills. Fuck the gift card, you have to give me a shopping spree to catch me back in that store. If Futureshop / Best Buy wasn't the only major store of it's kind, I'd boycott them all, but I'll be damed if that store manager at Heartland is going to make any money from profit sharing off me!

The Dog Ate My Homework Well... not exactly. You see my exam that I studied for till 3am in the morning, was cancelled by our teacher, 15 minutes after it was supposed to start. Why you ask? Somehow a computer science teacher, managed to corrupt a document. Something I haven't been able to do since I stopped using floppies. I mean, HOW? Email it to your account at school, go to school, and print it up. Why is it that this teacher gets away with it, but when I use to say my document got corrupted and wouldn't print, the teacher would look at me and say " Well, who's problem is that? [Just once I wanted to say "Hewlett-Packard's apparently!"]. Not to mention waiting 15 minutes before the test to actually print it out! Don't get me wrong, having an extra two weeks is a god-sent, but I was ready to kick some ass, and now I gotta wait two more weeks. Such is life I guess. Looks like I'm going to hold on to Generals. It's still buggy as hell, and I think EA needs to have someone kick them in the teeth. However, I learned today I have a lot to learn after getting my ass handed to me on a silver platter... by the medium difficulty CPU controlled army! I think I have an inability to do 500 things at once. So I get screwed in RTSs. While I'm on the topic of Electronic Arts, here's my idea. The next time they come out with a big launch, I'm going to push to see if I can get people NOT to buy it on the first three days or so. Since the first day the game is never out anyway, and then you buy it on the second, you’re only missing out on about a day and a half. Assuming the game comes out on Tuesday, it will leave you purchasing the game Friday afternoon, right on time for a weekend game fest. It's just to let those money hungry bastards know that YOU notice they are slacking, and that YOU will not stand for a continued string of released games that are obviously nowhere close to 100% completed. Now all I have to do is convince a good 50% of hardcore gamers that it will make a difference. Stay tuned! For those of you that don't visit urlLink [ Stu's Site ] . I recommend urlLink [ this, for a good laugh ] If you have Winamp, urlLink [ this skin ] is a MUST! Especially the cool feature where you double click it, and it compacts into a skinny bar at the top of your screen, with all the buttons still there!

Books, Online Games, and a soapbox! I'm not sure what relevance that has to anything I'm about to touch on, but you know what? It sounded cool! Oh well, time to unistall, I don't have time to debug browsers, just so I don't get flooded with pop-ups RIGHT! That being said, there are rumours out about trainers for C&C: Generals, which sucks ass. Why people have to cheat is beyond me. I'd ask you to email me and tell me, but apparently you're all too lazy to submit you opinion thru e-mail since every time I ask, no one fucking answers! Useless buggers! Keep reading though... ok? I'm on a roll tonight, one final thing. On the topic of commenting, I'm trying to learn ASP to set up a comments section after each blog, but I really don't have the time, so if anyone wants to do it... let me know, and we can talk. I know you're out there. I can feel you now. I know that you're afraid... afraid of us. You're afraid of change. I don't know the future. I didn't come here to tell you how this is going to end. I came here to tell how it's going to begin. I'm going to hang up this phone, and then show these people what you don't want them to see. I'm going to show them a world without you. A world without rules or controls, borders or boundaries. A world where anything is possible. Where we go from there is a choice I leave to you.

Party Like its Saterday February 8th Good times, good times! That’s all I have to say about my first ever Mario Party 4... uhh.. party! It was awesome! Mupiel myself and the ladies went all out on a game of MP4 [name is too long to type] and I had a blast. Basically the game is a board game, played on the GameCube with a twist. That twist? An abundant of little mini-games, and battles in which the players compete in things like three throw competitions, butterfly catching, and good old fashion line tracing, [don't ask] all the while using avatars from generations of your favourite Mario games! [Wish it was all of Nintendo, Link's absence was a distraction to me all night] As if you hadn't figure it out by now, I had a great time, and I plan on picking this game up when I can find a cheap copy, only because I'm poor though, it's worth the $70.00, although I can't see hours of enjoyment on it, unless you have a multitude of people to play it with, trash talking was the best part. Mupiel somehow managed to win the game, and I came in dead last, I didn't even get one freakin star! Board games will never be the same for me again [never mind that it's been 5 years since I played one], Mario Party 4 is the perfect game to play with 4 or more people, probably one of the best for a larger group[when you only have one console of course]. On top of all that gaming goodness it's got more replay value than most of your everyday board games, and most of the video games out there today, so you see, it's a win-win! In other news, Mupiel's gerbil can rip apart a toilet paper roll in under 5 minutes!

Remember the Good Old Days? When I used to actually post? Sorry it's been so long, doesn't happen often, but I should post something, keep my readers from losing intrest. I guess you all deserve an explanation... So here it is. Since Wednesday evening, I have done nothing but play Battlefield 1942 on my spare time. I love the new expansion, and also the web site that Stu pointed out to me that tracks muh progress. urlLink http://www.bfstats.com you don't even have to sign up, it just tracks you. So if you have played any sort of online Battlefield, then hit the website, and type in your screen name, see how your doing. My screen name is -=sw0rdfish=- but I'm not doing very well. Now... I lied... I know it's wrong, and I'm sorry (There I go with the ... again). I have also been spending a bit of time on this unreleased beta of an online game called urlLink There. Now I don't know how much I'm allowed to talk about, but who cares... you can get the just of it from the website. To me it seems like an alternate life, you have to spend money in real life to purchase money inside the game, and you can buy stuff for your online character, hoverbords, buggies, clothing and hairstyles. Thats the extent of the game though, I don't see any indepth play time. There is talk about adding Jobs that you can do, to earn some money, but then they would have to incorporate a monthly fee, (theres that Reoccuring Revenue again) or they wont make any money. However, like I told everyone I talked to before I even played it, if they get a high enough player count, they can put up advertiesments all over the place, and make a killing on it. Imagine my surprise last night, when I went to try on some new clothing, to see an entire "store" of Nike clothing... I just smiled and ran my avatar to the 99 cent shirts... shit I only have a certain amount of free money that they gave me... it's gotta last till Beta ends... no way I'm paying for fake money. The other alternative way to make money is to design objects, or paintjobs for existing objects and then pay to have the object listed. Everytime somone buys one, you get the money for it, in game money of course. Stay tuned, and I'll keep you informed! One last thing, some good new on my end. I notice someone in the Gamespot forms, and I emailed him regarding the site, to make a long story short, you may see some "sw0rdfish originals" game reviews on the site in the near future. urlLink addictgamers.com I think thats the URL. Fish Out! Oh, and sign my damn guest book! I waited a week, no one noticed it... Now I gotta tell you... SIGN IT... pretty please :o) **Bats Eyelashes**

Ok, so I just finished a 3 hour online session of Road to Rome, and let me tell you. I'm ready for three more, except my stomach keeps b*tching for food. Before I eat, I want to get this down for anyone who cares. Value on this expansion is unreal. For 20 bucks, you can't go wrong. New Vehicles: First you have the tanks, while a little difficult to use a lone, with the help of a team mate, these things are lethal. The Cannon has limited aiming, naturally, to about 90 degree straight ahead (45 each way) but with someone on the top using the 360degree high-powered gun.. not machine gun like, more power, less precision needed, brutal damage to those pesky Panserrachets(sp?) and Bazookas. They put in a few new weapons, nothing major, mostly just stuff to fill out the new armies, and they through the engineers a bone, giving them standard bayonets for close range hand-to-hand... still wimps, but can take out a tank in seconds. The armies are simply for fun, I didn't notice anything beneficial about them, new guns and the sort equal their counterparts. However with the new expansions comes the new Italian Maps, and boy are they a blast. Setting is definitely Italian in the ones I spent most of my time on... Very neat Mountain/Hill based levels, with flags on top, and the bottom.. Sucks being on the bottom, but then that’s all part of the fun right? Grab a plane, drop behind enemy lines, and go bock on some poor sap looking over the edge while you fire your cannon up their ass. I don't think I played all the new maps, I tried, but every time I got started on a server, I got smoked, and had to stick around to make up for myself... I'm not doing to great with this game lately, doesn't help that on the one map near the beach we lost all the flags, minus one, and they surrounded us, up on cliffs and hills, and proceeded to blank us in grenades, carpet bombing from above, and tanks from the outside... I think I died 10 times in the span of 3 minutes... not fun. What else can I say about this, other than it gets sw0rdfish's approval of value, excellence, and pure gaming goodness? If you enjoy the original, the expansion is a must. Best part about Battlefield is bfstats.com, IMO anyway. I love stats, and this web site tracks all sorts from various servers. While I can't get the "play” option to work from the site, just logging in through battlefield to a server that they monitor will count stats. This is for all of Battlefield, not just the expansion. As far as the single player goes, I didn't even try. Bots are probably still pretty stupid, but when it comes to Battlefield it's an Online game, with offline capabilities... if you want offline, stick with Medal of Honor.

Tragedy... And I never heard about it? I didn't do much today other than recover from whatever kicked my ass last night, and did some homework. So I don't got much to say on that. I'd like to touch on something that irked me today. I don't follow the news 100%, but I read the paper daily, which is to say I skim thru and read articles that catch my eye. I see the news now and again, but most of my info I get on those news breaks and everything. As well as the skimming. Now as many of you may or may not have heard, 7 Grade 10 students died in BC on Saturday in an avalanche, the same day of the shuttle incident, and I'm a little dumbfounded as to why the shuttle got on so many front pages, news bulletins, and top stories, yet the tragic loss of 7 kids is a back seat especially here in Canada. I'm not weighing one life against another, but those Astronauts died doing their job, they knew the risk, and they have my respect, and are hero's for it... but these students were out on a field trip, and it cost them their lives, and myself, the average news watcher, doesn't find out till 2 days later when it finally makes the front page, because they didn't find any debris from the shuttle that day. I'll take some of the blame, because I focused in on top stories only, but I didn't get to chose the top stories. Now that I think about it, the incident did cross my path, but I never knew it was recent, or that it happened in BC, because all it was, was 7 faces in the top 1/10th of The Star, and it said "Loss" and right under it... taking up the other 9/10th was the picture of the shuttle. Both Tragedy, both devastating, one covered, one forgotten. But that’s just me...

New Games, New Patches and The Flu All 3 things I own, or intend to own by tomorrow evening. Starting with the Flu. Got home from school today, and WHAMO! I feel like one of them Mack trucks ran me over on the way home or something. Painfull, sleepy, tired, sore. You name it, I got it... and it bites! I think I'm going to bed after this! Anyway, onto important topics. Battlefield release patch 1.3. A bunch of new stuff. Hit up urlLink Gamespot to get all the details. I happen to have the patch sitting on my Hard Drive, so if you want it and don't have a Gamespot account, and you don't want to wait in line at FilePlanet. MSN me, and sw0rdfish will hook you up. While I'm on the subject of Battlefield 1942, tomorrow is the release date for the expansion pack Road to Rome for $30CDN you can't go wrong... and the best part is I'll get to wear the Italian flag, second best thing to adding in the Canadian flag, guess Diepe wasn't enough! There are a bunch of new releases coming out in the next week or so. Unreal II , and Command and Conquer: Generals to name a couple. The former is getting complaints of weak game play, and the latter is getting what every EA Published game is getting latley... "It's really buggy!!!!" Again, Gamespot forums, and other places like IGN (Yucky!) have feedback, and previews posted, but I'm too wiped to read them all and fill you in. After I hear more I'll make some noise about it, if it's worth making noise about. One last thing, the gas companies are stringing us all along. I doubt very much it's coincedence that every time the gas prices are high, them come down on Sunday, only to have them all go back up on Monday, except one. One company keeps them low for that extra day, and everyone freaks cuz they are getting a great deal on gas... 71 cents instead of 80... Thats not a deal, they mess with your min and make you think your saving, when a week ago it was 65cents... See how they scam us? Bastards. Then again, with the 8 cent raise per liter, it only costs you 4 bucks extra, per 50 liters (my tank is about that size, if that). So why bother searching... just stop, and pay the lousy 4 bucks, and save yourself the time and trouble. Thats what I say anyway. ~SickFish~

A Monthly What?!!! Yeah that’s what I said when my friend Variation told me, about 3 years ago, about Everquest, and the fact that you had to pay a monthly fee for it! "10 Bucks a Month, to play a video game?? Are you serious?" He was, and so began my monthly cash drain. Now before I go any further, you ever hear a loud noise while you're sleeping... and then you just can't get back to sleep? Well this is why I'm up at 3:16am on a Saturday morning. You see, our neighborhood is on the fritz, and the power is surging about 4 times and hour. Well, me being the brain that I am decided it was a good idea to leave the Sheridan laptop on my desk. Kasey (my cat) decided he was going to nap on it, well, the power surged, he freaked and ended up sending the laptop flying. BOOM! So I jumped about 6 feet off my bed, looked around... saw a tail leaving the room, and threw my teeth-guard at him. Stupid animal! Stupid Hydro! Apparently urlLink I'm not the only one with power issues. Now that my heart rate is pounding, I thought I'd share some interesting information with all of you. Especially if you own an X-Box! Apparently Microsoft plans on releasing a new slimmer, sleeker X-Box, with the same specs as the other, only this one would cost... $99 USD. The catch? You have to sign up for X-Box Live, which they plan on charging for, using a monthly cost system similar to MMOGs of today. Now! This is my thoughts, and I'm bias because I'm not a huge console kinda guy. Why bother? I mean, games on consoles aren't that great to warrant you passing up on a free online FPS on your PC, that Joe from Utah can host on is own computer. The reason you have to pay (or will have to pay) for X-Box live, and I'll assume the PS2 soon, is because MS and Sony have to run servers for these gamers to play on, you can't host a game on your X-Box, at least not yet! Call me old fashion, but I'll stick to my PC. No matter how advanced consoles get, they will never beat my PC, and I love my PC! Anyway, the fact is that if you own a console, and the online gaming is a huge part of it, then I recommend that you adjust your budget to include a monthly fee for the online service, starting next year sometime... and if they start charging per game also, you’re in a heap of trouble!
