Things Lookin' Up Well, today's soccer game went much better, for the team anyway. I played like shit, but in the end we came out with the 5 - 3 win, and I didn't get suspended. I've been playing Zelda: Wind Waker the last two days, I got a free copy from a PR guy I know. I was pretty stoked about that. Then today, Tenchu: Wrath of Heaven , and Winning Eleven 6 show up at my door. For free, from urlLink [ AddictGamers ] , again free... or were they. UPS charged me 61.00 for "Tax and Brokerage". Ok Tax, I get. GST, PST... no problem. What the fuck is brokerage though? So I call UPS, and the bitch on the other end of the line tells me that brokerage fees are what UPS charges for having to do all the paper work on a ground shipment. This pissed me off, but you know what, life is full of fees, and thats a battle I'm never going to win. HOWEVER!!!! Get this, I asked why they were higher this time, then they were the last time I got a package. She says "because this time the value of the package was more" Can someone explain to me how paper work for a $5 item, is any different from the paper work for a $1,000 item? I was so pissed off, and I even asked her that, and she just kept repeating "thats the fee, for that price range of items. I swear, any way to make a buck! So in the end, I pay 60 bucks, for two games I hadn't planned on buying, and now I'm thinking, how the hell can I get around this bullshit, so I can review games for a website, get free games. I mean, out of all this shit over 2 video games, the only company who makes a killing off of it, is UPS! Whatever, I hold my view in life, that there are only 2 companies that are really worth running. Banks and a shipping company. Both rob you blind. Anyway, whats a guy to do. I need some sleep. got a long day of Zelda tomorrow! [ oh yeah, and school ]

The Double Entendre! w00y! Starting today, until I get an ASP thing working, we can comment on my posts. urlLink [ here ] . I'll start topics, or else you can go and start them yourself, I'll even link there when I'm not lazy! So, todays topic just, came to me... well sorta. Kinda like the way my new Gameboy Advanced SP just came to me. It's the ultimate marketing ploy, the collector's dream, and the poor man's worst nightmare... the re-release! I'll be the first to admit that I'm a sucker for it, but then again, I can't be the only one. Why would Sony re-release things just so I buy them... right? While the GBAsp isn't exactly a re-release, its a Gameboy Advance... with... [ wait for it ] added bonuses. Namely the light, and the rechargable batteries. I've been lacking and missing Gameboy since Gameboy Colour came out, and I felt like a lose toting around my big ass Gameboy, with a black and white screen. So I figured this wasn't me getting sucked into it, I resisted the first release, and they got me on the second. It does however lead me into today's blog. Why we must always have EVERYTHING, that the release. DVDs, Videogames, VHS, they are all abord the re-release/special edition train... and I don't see it ending anytime soon. Personally, I have a feeling I'm going to be owning about 4 copies of Lord of The Rings: The Fellowship of The Ring by the end of 2004, and who knows how many re-releases they have. After all Peter Jackson said so himself... he's all about the bonus DVD features. This may get costly. In the end its all a matter of opinion, self control, ego, and the size of your wallet. Do I NEED that?, I'll just wait for the trillogy to come out!, Am I truly a fanif I don't have it on it's release day?, It's only 20 bucks!!! There you have the biggest excuses I have given myself for buying or not buying... but mostly buying, special editions, extended editions, and the dreaded Box Set . I've done it since I was able to beg my mom to buy me that G.I. Joe, and then buy me the same G.I. Joe but with a blue hat, and I'm sure I'll continue to do it for the rest of my life. Thru the nagging kids, the logical thinking wife, and the little angel that sits on my right shoulder, the left shoulder will ALWAYS have the right decision, and I wouldn't have it any other way! ~QuOtH the sw0rdfish... EvErMoRE!~

Would You Like to Biggie Size That? I say no, and then I still end up with " Biggie Fries ." You know what the problem is? Naming conventions. They make no fucking sense! Primary example, Starbucks [ I'm too lazy to link there ]. They have 3 sizes, Grande, Tall, Venti . Which one is the small? Beat me! You see, it makes no damn sense, unless your a Starbucks' regular, then there is no way to know. how do you even pronounce them? Tall is easy, but after that, fuck it. I still use Large, Small and Medium when I go there. Anyway, this came from my journey to the car wash. The attendant said "Ultra, Supreme, or Total," all I wanted to do was wash the salt off my car, so I wanted a basic wash, but which one was it? Assuming he went smallest to largest, I said "Ultra... I guess." Turns out that was the works, and my car is cleaner than I am, but thats not the point. I mean, what one person thinks of Ultra, another thinks of Supreme. Mind you Total makes me think, the total package... but that would make life too easy! In the end it's just a ploy to get us to spend money, but wouldn't naming the lesser car washes "Useless", and "Light Cleaning" make most people choose, "Supreme Clean". Again, too simple. It's bad enough McDonald's no longer has Large fries, they go from Medium to Supersize. [ I give up! ] So in the end, I was please with my car wash, and Sunoco got an extra buck or two from me, I'll have to use 1-800-CALL-ATT next time to save a buck or two :o) I'd like to take this moment to thank you all for stopping by on a regular basis. I enjoy yammering to the world, and it's easier when I know a some point, someone is on the other end listening. Feel free to post your thoughts in my Tag, I'll answer questions or join the chat! Now I have to get back to my assignment, it's due in 8 hours, and I have yet to get deep into it. Lets get a topic of discussion going, whats your favourite movie of all time, and why? Tag it, we'll see if a blog comes of it :o) ~Fish Out of Water~

What that allows anyone and everyone to do is to leave a message, WITH smilies for me and anyone else who wanders by. Basically this give you lazy bastards less of a reason to not responding to my requests. I expect to see them to pop up on everyone else's blogs soon, but I have the distinct privilege of being the first of my circle of friends to hook-it-up. Ok on to things that really matter. T.A.T.U's song All the things she said is about lesbians... it's catchy, and the video is hot. So why isn't this song #1 worldwide? Personally I think it's got a pretty decent message, but the video kinda takes that message and throws it out the window, because all the guys watching it are drooling, and all the girls are smacking their drooling boyfriends. It does pretty much the same thing Dirrty did to Aguilara's [ who cares if I spelt it wrong ] entire album. I wanted to touch on something, and I really have no idea how much sense it's actually going to make. It's about the world latley, and the bullshit, as far as I'm concerned anyway. Here let me grab my box of Sunshine Washing Detergent and get comfortable. [ thats a play on soapbox, for my slower audience ] Ever since I read the article in Chart Magazine [ see yesterday ], I've been thinking about CNN, Dub-ya! and the United Nations. I've come to a few conclusions. I don't think I'm ever going to watch CNN again. It's just a bunch of rich people feeding humanity's morbid curiosity of death, and destruction and they'll feed us all the same food, until ratings go down, and no matter how important it is to get us that information, they don't care. Iraq:Showdown, NASA Disaster, Operation Freedom. The latter which is still going on in Afghanistan, they just don't care about it anymore. I didn't realize how little I knew about Iraq post-gulf-war until Raine suggested I look around. I mean, Saddam is rebuilding palaces, an army, and his defences and weapons, and not caring one bit for the people just letting them die. CNN doesn't tell you that. Is dropping more bombs on these people really going to solve anything? What are the chances that your actually going to kill Saddam this time? Not that he doesn't deserve to be hung by his testicles, but not at the expense of the innocent. This brings me to this weekend's bullshit. The United Nations was built to protect world peace, the US signed on, and now Bush thinks he's above the UN? That he can do as he pleases? Doesn't take a wake-up call to realize how fucking stupid that is. They make rules, impose them, but the second it comes to them following them. The rule book is gone. I think Bush needs to be hung beside Saddam. Then again, war makes money right? And it's in Iraq, so no one gets hurt right. At least thats what Bush wants us to believe. I just hope Jean has the balls to stand beside France and say you can't do this... not without our support, and not without doing it the right way. Disarm Iraq, I'm all for it. Just don't fool us into thinking the only person that gets hurt is Saddam.

Condolences I'm not going to write much, just wanted to pass my thoughts to MrE who lost his turtle. I'm sure she's up, wherever turtles go, chilling with Ernie, Burt, Ernie II, Hitman and Anvil... Who Said the Twins Would Wait Till 19!?? Yes, I am referring to the Olsen Twins, and Yes... I am referring to them becoming whores. Ok, so the only thing they are whoring is their name, but it's still pathetic. I was in Walmart the other day, and I saw Mary Kate, and Ashley in four, count them FOUR different departments. Electronics [ video games and movies... yes I said video games ] WHAT THE FUCK IS THAT???? Clothing [ Their own clothing line? What the fuck!!! ] Toy Department [ Yes I went in there! And it was to look for the dolls I suspected existed ] Bedding [ OMG! Bed Sheets? I can just see the 40 year old putz, leaving with him mom, using these ] Anyway, I don't blame them, I mean, I wouldn't turn down all that money either. I do blame the marketing schmucks who came up with the idea, and Acclaim, for releasing such a fruity game. On to my next rant... www.stopmessenger.com . Now if you'll notice, I didn't make that a Hyper-Link... because I don't want you to go there. I just want it to show up on search engines. These are the assholes who think they can go and use the Windows Messenger Service [ I don't mean messenger as in the instant messenger, I mean the windows service... I'll get to that in a second ] as a form of advertising. First my e-mail, and now this? Well fear not, I'm going to show you a quick and easy way to take care of these losers. Follow the Fish, and all will be well. First let me state that this will not interfere with MSN Messenger, so don't be afraid, it'll just stop ads like this; Click on Start Select Control Panel Performance and Maintenance [ skip for Win 98/95/2000 ] Administrative Tools Double Click Services Scroll down to Messenger - Double Click It Change "Startup Type" to Disabled Click "STOP" Click "APPLY" Close all the windows. Done That should do the trick. No more messages interrupting you, and kicking you out of games while your trying to play. I wish they would make Internet Advertising TOTALLY illegal. I don't want to read advertisements, if I did, I'd go to an advertisement site. Feel my anger! Best $20 you can spend... Worms Battle Pack for the PC. Hours of fun. If you can't find the battle pack, [ Best Buy has them in Mississauga ] then get Worms Armageddon. Blog ya Lata!

An Inability to Grab the Balls Between My Legs! Blarg! What a shitty game we played yesterday. Before I get into that, I'll apologize for the lack of blogging. Var got here on Wednesday, and we've been playing video games ever since! I'll touch on all that after I explain the rude title. Last night, after a horrible first half, our team was down 4-1. I was playing keeper, and I'll take responibility for one goal, while at the same time, it's hard to stop a shot from 6 feet out. Anyway, after the team battled all the way back to eaven it up at 5 all, an innocent slow roller came tumbling toward me, I looked up to make a quick outlet pass... the next thing I knew the ball was rolling into the net behind me. If I could I would have dug a hole in the turf, and crawled inside it. I know understand how Bill Buckner felt, then again, his was for the World Series. Our team took it pretty hard and fell apart, they never recovered, and we lost by two, [ the last goal was a 3 on none, I seriously thought about just letting them score by walking away ]. Life goes on, and I'll get em next week. Best Buy finally decided to get their act in gear, and call me back. The store manager offered me a $50.00 discount/gift card, so I went in and bought Mario Party 4 for 17 bucks. I'm addicted. I've already reviewed it, so you can go and look thru my archieves if you want to hear about it. It's much fun, even single player. urlLink [ Read it here just scroll down to February 15th. ] I'm back kicking it with Sim City 4. With a little help from PC Gamer [ No Cheats ] I was able to hit 10,000 population, I'm going to work on it tonight once I get Jen's Uncle's computer... It's in need of severe CPU CPR. We'll have to see what time it is when all that is finished. More work to do to get Var settled in, really tought with me going to school, and him having no car. So tomorrow's lunch, for those of you at Sheridan, we're hitting Erin Mills Town Centre, wanna come? Fish Out!

Rampage I used to spend countless quarters at the arcade when I was a kid, trying to beat the game rampage, and no matter how much money I had, I always ran out before the end. Then I got the Nintendo version played it all day, night, and the next day, and if memory serves me right, I never did hit the end, maybe there isn't one. Anyway, now we can find out thanks to Shockwave. With it's version of urlLink [ Midway's Rampage ] Complete with Lizzy, George and Ralph and the sexy helpless lady who can someone how survive 15 story falls... I've yet to figure that one out. Anyway, you'll need Shockwave installed to play it, and the controls were the easiest with a joystick. It's not as good, but it does bring back some good times! urlLink [ Stu ] likes to trash talk a lot. Go see what he had to say about me fearing him, I remember him breathing my fumes most of the nights we went out there. Unfortunately when the moon aligned with Venus, and the earth's 14 millionth star lined up with the 15 millionth, and Stu grabbed a car with NoS in it... he posted ONE fast lap time that I haven't been able to get more than 0.20 seconds from, but whats 1/5th of a second between friends? Truth be known I don't like being treated like a nobody when I'm giving your company [ Formula Kartways ] 100 bucks a month, so I refuse to go back to Formula, I'd like to hit another track, so we'll have to talk about it. ~Fish Out~

Oh Say Can You See? Hey Hey! Whats going on Fish Inc. back in effect! w00y! Got home from New York City about 4 hours ago or so, and between fixing urlLink [ My Dad's ] website, which somehow broke... i don't know how. Nor do I know how I fixed it, it just worked... I'll blame the host. Anyway, back to New York. I stayed at the Roosevelt, and the room was built for little people. I kid you not. The room was supposed to fit 4 comfortably, but every night my feet hung off the end of my bed, and staying on " my side of the bed " was impossible unless you have no shoulders... Anyway, on top of that, it had no internet connection. $150.00 US a night, and it doesn't come with an internet connection, and the business centre was down, so my Fish Inc Live from New York was a no go, as was my e-mail, and all the things that help me be the most reachable guy in the world! Moving forward, we did most of the things that we set out to do in New York, including those tasty beer nuts.. . mmmm, hot sweet beer nuts **insert Homer Simpson drool here** Damn those things were good, and you get a shit load for a buck! I miss them already! We hit up NBC studios for their tour, was pretty cool, learnt a lot. Did the Empire State Building, the subways, taxis and all that other stuff that is synonymous with New York, including Time Square! That was one awesome place, I don't think things ever closed in Time Square, and the beer-nut guy never went home, he just sat there and sold... sold... sold... and I am thankful! Virgin Records was open at 1AM on a Sunday Morning, allowing us to grab some Coldplay imports, and this huge Music Store had every tab book in the world, picked up the Parachutes Album's tab book. We also went to Canal St. which is where all the illegal stuff happens. Stolen and knock-off purses, watches, jewelry, and DVDs galore. I picked up Catch Me If You Can and Jackass for $10 US, the quality isn't that great, but I won't complain, I hadn't planned on buying those DVDs anyway, so now I get to laugh my ass off at Jackass for 5 bucks! Who needs quality on that movie anyway, it's good, it's just not DVD or nothing and the chapters don't work, they send you like 20 minutes ahead, instead of the next chapter, I wouldn't buy a DVD off the streets of New York unless you just want to see it, in which case it's just like renting it... Someone had to test them right? Moving on, we visited ground zero, very tough at times... Nothing much left, but it does bring back the memories, as well as a realization that this did happen, and that 3000+ people died, just going to work. I didn't appreciate all the bastards making money off this tragedy, including bobble-head FDNY and NYPD. I can just see the poor kid, who's dad was a fireman and he died in the WTC, walking down the street and see this little toy head bobbling around wearing the uniform his dad wore honourably, being disgraced for a few bucks. There is a lot of stuff for sale about 911, and none of it mentions any widow's funds, or relief... just greedy people making money. I don't know, that really irked me. Keeping with the sombre mood, Sunday afternoon we went to Strawberry Fields. It's a part of Central Park dedicated to John Lennon, [ my musical idol ] right across the street from the urlLink [ Dakota ] where he lived. It was another tough one. I don't know about you, but when you hear stories or news about some tragic incident, it doesn't matter if its a year later, or 22 years later, but when you see the place, and actually stand on the place where it happened, it just makes it that much more real, and that much more tragic... I am glad to say that there was no one selling John Lennon bobble-heads here. I'll post some pictures of the place and New York, as soon as I get them. Games... I just got into the urlLink [ Shadowbane ] beta. It's the new but much delayed [ at least two years in fact ] MMOG coming out from Ubi Soft. It's primarily PVP [ Player vs. Player] so I don't think I'll be spending too much time in it, but you never know, all depends how good I am at it. I've got some PR stuff here from AddictGamers that I need to go through, and review. However with the two midterms I have this week, I doubt I'll get much time with anything other than the one Oxygen PR CD. Shadowbane will have to wait. While I'm on the topic of school, I got offered a position with CCRA again, no clue if it's going to still be available since they sent the email Friday, and asked for a response " TODAY " but thanks to the hotel, I only checked my email when I got home. I'll let you know, if you care that is. Not much else to tell you, I'm gonna call it a night, roll over, and get some sleep. Var gets here in a few days, and we got a lot of shit to do to get his space ready. Fish Out! This post dedicated to the memory of John Lennon, died December 8th 1980

Rumors of my Death, Greatly Exaggerated Well it's been a crazy week. Not to the extant that I've been busy that I couldn't blog. I just didn't have the computer to do it. Let me explain. Sunday night I sat down to build my step-dad's PC, only to realize that his old Video card, wasn't going to fit in the new Motherboard, like I thought it would. After a trip to the computer store, and a killer deal an an ATI Sapphire Radeon 9100, I decided there was no point wasting that much power in a non-gaming PC. So I did what anyone in my position would do. Took my GeForce 3 out, popped in the Radeon, and then my computer went to hell in a handbasket! I don't really know what the hell happened, but when I took it in to get looked at, [ I thought the card was defective ] it worked, but we noticed that the fan on my Northbridge died! Not good! 10 minutes of my PC being on, and the MoBo would have burned up like Bacon... mmmm crispy! So i dabble in some creative engineering to get a fan to fit on the Northbridge, and it seems to be working ok, I'll have to check on it in a few days. None the less, that took a day to sort out, not to mention that I was rebuilding the only other Internet ready PC in the house, since laptops went back to Sheridan. So you see, I had no way of contacting the outside world. I was closed off from existence, no one knew where I was. The rumors started swirling, and thus everyone feared sw0rdfish was no more! But alas! I'm here! [ sorry ] Of course, a lack of communication didn't stop me from adding a new member to the household. I call her, Telly!... Toshiba 34-Inch TheaterWide® Television 16:9 HD Compatible monitor, 34" direct view TV. 1000 lines of resolution and 2 Tuner PIP. Exclusive microfilter CRT with lavendar mask. Key Product Features and Options Features Microfilter Advanced CRT Colour Technology provides extremely accurate colour purity by assigning individual colour filters to each phosphor array on the surface of the CRT. FST Pure™ CRT features a flat-glass viewing surface, which lets you see more picture from a greater ranger of angles, with less light reflection compared to a traditional radius CRT. Lavender Shadow Mask prevents internal light deflection, heightens contrast, and improves focus and brightness. IDSC II (1080i/480p) incorporates Hyper Progressive Scan Technology, allowing the TV to accept 480i/480p/1080I input signals. The system automatically upconverts 480i to 480p by utilizing an expanded memory buffer. The result is a smooth, sharp, flicker-free image without picture degradation or motion artifacts. 3:2 Pulldown Detection and Compensation creates proper reconstruction of film-based content (24 fps) on video and eliminates artifacts and jagged edges caused by improper processing. Dynamic Quadruple Focus provides superior detail focus and increased picture performance for large-screen and flat picture tubes. Convenience 56-Key Backlit Universal Audio/Video Remote Control Favourite Channel Channel Label Speed Surf Trilingual On-Screen Display Clock Channel Lock Off Timer One Button Sleep Timer Front Panel Lockout Closed Captioning 2-Level Mute Video Lock Video Label Direct Input Selection Individual Video Memory Front Terminals Now I don't know what most of that means, the more TV technically inclined may... but it looks really freakin cool! Nice picture and everything. I've been spending the last 36 months plus wondering when i'll be able to upgrade from my 13" sony... after taking a huge chuck out of all my debts, and going back to work, I jumped at Best Buy's 24 Months, Equal Payments/No Interest. As long as nothing bad happens to my government job, I should be ok [ **knocks on wood ] Well I guess this is long enough for now, I smell bacon and eggs, and I'm going to go eat them, I don't care who's they are or who made them. I'mma go claim em! Peace!

C'est le But!!!! Kick ass game of street hockey today. About 10 people showed up by the time is was all said and done, and I must say I had a killer time! Not including the slap shot I took right in the marbles... I thought they were in my throat. I can honestly say I've never been squared that bad, as it continues to hurt almost 12 hours later. I'm not really sure why I'm talking about this, in public no less, but I have to complain somewhere. Anyway, the nausea and the light-headed feeling only lasted about 15 minutes, after that it was just pain... but it seemed to elevate my game. I stopped missing passes, and started putting the ball home. Although I got robber a few times also. We'll have to get more out next time, maybe have three or four teams so that we can rest in between games and play more. Who knows! I had a blast, and that is all that really matters. Tomorrow I'll be building my step-dad's new PC. Upgraded from a PII 450, to a AMD 2700+. not a bad jump if you ask me. 512MB of DDR ram for only $99. What are you waiting for? Go! I'm Done!
Spammed Out Comments section is gone, was getting spammed for some odd reason. Like it's worth advertising here! Fucking Idiots.

Spring Cleaning Indeed it was. I spent most of last night reformatting my PC. It had been acting slow recently, and Internet Explorer kept freezing up. So instead of troubleshooting, I just wiped it clean. Running much better now. As long as I keep the amount of games I install limited to those I'm going to play. I have a nasty habit of installing stuff. Never knew that every time you install something, even if you un-install, it ads to your load times etc... More useless geek news from Fish Inc. Also got my crap from Lik-Sang finally. Stupid government taxed my ass. Anyway, the case is ok... I think I'll pick one up like Yan has, only for the SP. The screen cover, after some install issues, is great, and same goes for the headset adapter. I can play with sound at work now! whooo! Peace!

Alice, Dorthy, and Strawberry Shortcake As many of you know, I love urlLink [ Penny-Arcade ] and I read it regularly... mainly because the comic is great, sometimes just to see what they have to say about new games... but mostly the comic. On Friday last week, they posted this; And yesterday, American Greetings, American McGee's people, and Strawberry Shortcake herself forced them to take it down to avoid legal action. Now if you ask me, the comic is hilarious, and it's satirical, which as far as I know isn't illegal, but hey, I'm no Judy Brown. Anyway, doing this just raises more awareness of who Penny-Arcade is, and I'm sure they don't mind one bit. In the end the comic gets posted all over the place [ like here ] and more people see it than would have, if they just shut up about it. They being American Greetings. My work is done!

From the Outside, Something Looks Wrong It's weird. I was born in Montreal, lived there for almost 9 years, and every year I watched the Habs on TV. Most of the time, they made the playoffs, and even won a cup. However, for the last 5 years, last year excluded, playoff hockey for the Canadiens has been, well... a first round sweep, and 4 no-shows. Now, living in Toronto, that means that my April, May, and June [ although not often ] hockey, is comprised of watching the Leafs. I used to think that being a Habs fan meant I had to hate the leafs, but then I never wanted to see them lose. I used to tease my friends when they did lose, because... thats what I thought a Habs fan was supposed to do. Maybe it's the lack of meaningful games between the two of them, and the non-existence of a playoff series since 1967 but I don't hate them, in fact, as Green scored last night I found myself shouting " SCORES!!! " and I sat back down, and though... What would my grandpa think? He was arguably the biggest Habs fan, and that has definitely rubber off on me. Stories of Dryden, Richard, and all the greats used to fill my head as a child. Thats when it hit me, maybe 15 minutes ago, or maybe yesterday... it's a big league now, 30 teams, and a whole lot of rivalries. If I was a Senators fan, I think I would hat ethe leafs... Why? because they have eliminated the Senators in the past 3 playoffs... thats why! I'm still waiting for this huge Montreal-Toronto series, been waiting for it since I was about three [ thats the earliest I can remember liking hockey, probably the earliest I can remember period]. As I was saying... it hit me, if Montreal is out golfing, what better team is there to take the cup then the leafs? My friends would all be happy. We could go out, and they may even buy me a drink they're so happy. I still consider myself a huge Habs fan, and there is no way I would even question who I want to win a leafs-Habs game. My heart is Red, White & Blue and there is no doubting that... but when the red gets the kibosh, and they're out golfing... I think the Blue and White gets a little stronger each year, but only until October. I think my dad would be proud of that. I either need a Montreal-Toronto playoff series soon, or never. I haven't decided yet. Go Habs Go... [ and the leafs too... for now ]

Tis Today! Well, I didn't get too much hate mail from people. Just one from a white guy that works at McDonald's, complaining about the White Trash who can't order properly in drive through. I don't even know the guy! I digress [I don't know if thats appropriate, I just like saying it ]. Well, I called Tim's head office today, and after about 5 minutes on the phone, the lady on the other end tells me to take it in to Tim Horton's [ any store ] and tell them it's defective, and to refund it. What the fuck do you think I did the first 5 times? Then I asked, why when the store calls in, can they not get an answer in 5 minutes, and it takes them 3 weeks. She said she didn't know, and apologized for the inconvinence... apologize? Give me free shit! I don't complain to get free stuff, don't get me wrong. Nor do I complain unless something is REALLY pissing me off. However, when a customer has to do all this work just to get a 15 dollar mug refunded, and the solutions ends up being this simple... well fuck you! Make it up to me! My time is worth more than 15 dollars, and it's your fault I'm wasting it! Companies do this sort of thing mainly because out of 10 cases, 7 probably give up, and don't get their money back. Same philosophy as the "Mail-In Rebate." Why isn't it an instant rebate, and let the store deal with the manufacture? Simple, because I'd say 40% at least probably don't bother, forget, or "lose" their information required for the rebate. I have 2 sitting on my desk as I type, one for $50 for a MS Sidewinder, and one for $10 for the Friends DVDs. If I keep forgetting, there is $60 that two companies will make off me. I wont let that happen, cuz I'm a cheap bastard, but I'm sure many do. Still nothing new in gaming, but I did get the first three seasons of Friends, my all-time favourite sitcom... so I'll be busy this week! One final thing, I have a request. Save EVERY A.O.L. disk you have, and save every "Prepaid Postage" envelope that you have. I'm on a mission. I'll pick them up from you, if you live in the neighbourhood. Otherwise, forget about it! Peace~

Tim Horton's Service Fuck it! Why? Because they don't have any. Now no disrespect to minorities, nor to the ones who I'm refering to in this post. If you know me, you know that I don't look at skin color for a second. Nor do I care about it! Here's my beef with Tim Horton's. They hire imigrants, "fresh off the boat" so to speak, yet they can't speak english. This becomes a problem when you are ordering at the drive through. It's hard enough to understand somone who speaks perfect english through them, when you throw in a heavy accent, and a very bad understanding of the english language, you get 5 minute waits trying to explain that you want a bagel with cheese, and a double double! It gets down right aggravating when the person taking your order messes up, and then you have to sit there and explain what happened. Furthermore, I went in to Tim Horton's, 5 of them actually, complaining that my Stainless Steel Travel Mug that I bought off of them was broken. It took untll the 5th one when I got someone who actually understood my problem, and that was three weeks ago. I left my number, and I'm still waiting to hear back from the manager. I've been back 2 times to no avail. Head office is getting a call from me tomorrow, and if you work at Tim Horton's head office, don't answer the phone because I'm going to let you have it! Not about the inability of your employees to speak english, only about the cup. Let me clear something up, before you all start commenting about how I'm a prick. I have absolutly no problem with imigration, nor with any race of people who choose to move to our country. My issue comes from the companies who hire these people, probably because they will work for minimum wage the longest, and throw them on the floor where they have to interact with people in order to do their job, yet they can't speak english, or they can, they just don't do it well.
Happy Easter Go find them eggs!!!

And So It Begins Life after semester 5. Test are done, job starting date is nowhere in sight, I have no clue what the hell CCRA is doing, but they never have their act in gear. Which is stupid since they are the god damn government. I got into the Planetside beta last week, I'm just waiting for my CDs to get here in the mail. I'll let you guys know what I think about it, but Penny-Arcade did a pretty good job if it. Head over there if you want to check it out. [ use my link ] I'm looking forward to weeknights again, where I can sit back and game, and not have to worry about homework or shit like that. No matter how bad work is, it's better than school. I mean, you get paid to work, and at 5 o'clock [ unless you don't let it ] work ends, and you go home and do whatever you want! Of course this means that you don't get to decide for yourself if you want to go in or not, but those are minor details. My birthday was fun, apart from the " Hair Scare " with one plate of pasta, and my ice cream. Who knows if it was mine, or the cooks, so I just tossed it aside, and went on with the festivities. The Fat Lady Has Sung In a valiant fight, and never giving up. CST FC played their last game today, for the Winter/Spring '03 Season anyway. I was looking through my newspaper last night, and saw a picture that made me think... Tiger Woods, putting " The Green Jacket " on Mike Weir. Why did this make me think? Simply because the most desired trophy in golf is to win the Masters, and with all this controversy about women in Augusta, a black man [ last 2 years champion ] is putting the Jacket on a Canadian... wonder if the old "set in their ways" Americans ever thought that would happen at Augusta. Ah well, Weir is without question the best player in the PGA right now, and he's earned it. Good luck Mike, you've got my cheers! In other news, Stopmessenger continues to be a popular hit to my page. Maybe I should make a post and link to it, it really is very annoying! Not only that, but it's a public server that the students were using last night to get notes and slides from. I don't know how he became program head, he's a nice guy... Keep Rollin' Rollin' Rollin' 2 down, 3 to go. Of course I'm talking about school exams. 60 hours from now or so, I'll be worry free, and on the road to bigger and better things. Well, not really. I still have to go back in September for 4 more months, but a guy can dream right? I really feel like going off about Sheridan College right now, but I'll hold back. At least till I get really fucking mad. Speaking of pissed off, Tim Horton's is yet to answer me about my cup. I'll have to stop by AGAIN in the morning. Actually, I'll probably just call head office tomorrow. 3 weeks to get a response on a broken cup is stupid. Not to mention you can't email them, at least not from what I can find on the site. Same as McDonald's, what the hell is wrong with email complaints? Makes it to easy for us probably! Dicks! Well, now that I got that out of my system, there isn't much going on in the world of gaming lately. I've been really impressed with Winning Eleven 6, a soccer game from Konami. Its fun to play, but the commentator is a freakin moron! Not to mention they didn't take much time in recording lines for him to say. Normally you have to play a game for a long time to know EVERY line that he's gonna say. Well after a handful of games, its always the same damn lines, most notably " This will be trouble if it gets through ." Yeah thanks for giving away the fact that it's a through ball! Like the guy sitting next to me isn't going to notice my player making a run for it after you blurt that out? In the end though, it's about gameplay. Mute the retard, and the game is really fun. Takes time to get used to the controls, and the power shots, but all in all I love it, and I'm glad it found me. Now I need to write a review of it for AG. I'm surprised they haven't yelled at me yet. I'm slacking bad, but with just cause, exams are a bitch! Well until next time! Peace!

The Art of The All Nighter It's been awhile grant you, but I can still pull these all nighters no problem. The last time I think was for Joe Sant's final assignment last year. While we do have until midnight tomorrow [ which actually means 8am Thursday since he wont pick them up till then ] I'm working on getting it finished up tonight, so I don't have to sit in the school for another 12 hour session. I was there ALL day today, from 9:00am until 10:30pm, and i didn't like it! During those 13 hours, there were a few events worth noting, and while I enjoy my coffee break, I'll share them. We played the second place team today for Sheridan Intramural Indoor-Soccer, after falling behind early 2 - 0, we battled back in the second half to tie it with a little over 2 minutes left. I played keeper again, and I enjoyed it. Was seeing the ball well [ until the punk ran through the crease and knocked my hands out of the way... Ref thought otherwise ]. Turns out it's meaningless, the highest we could have finished is 4th, and 4th plays 5th, so our fate is written and these last two games are tune-ups for the playoffs. We're ready! Bring it! Next came dinner. At around 8:30pm or so, Yan and I began getting a "Wee bit peckish ". So we rang up Pizza Pizza, explained to them about 5 times that we needed the pizza delivered to the "Front Door of the School, NOT the Rez!!!" Sure enough, at 9:15 we get the call saying he's here... only he's not... he's at [ you guessed it ] the residence! Fast Food incompetence has irked me lately, so I took the receipt, was it said "Free if delivered after 9:18pm" ... it was 9:20, I smiled at the driver, felt bad, and explained that if he was going to get in shit for it, to tell his boss that it was the order takers fault for not writing clear instructions, although had the driver understood english, I could have reminded him to come to the school not the rez... but all he kept saying was "I leave now!" and then he ended up at the rez... Free Pizza always tastes better! Just when I thought the day was ending, and all I had left in my future was C assignment, I sat down to some Pokémon. Plan was to just get some levels for Pikachu or something, but instead I decided to see how hard the Elite Four actually were... 27 Revives, and 41 Hyper Potions later, I hit the final Poké with a critical hit, and it was all over, I was the new Pokémon League Champion... with a level 58, 49, 43, 42, 14 [ who levelled 3 times on one kill to 17 ] and a 12. So now, I just get to basically wonder the lands, and train and collect as much as I can. A perfect time waster. It actually put a huge dent in my magazine reading time as well as Zelda... on that note, congrats to my brother in gaming and school Mupiel, on finishing Zelda:TWW... you are the hero my friend, I bow to you Captain ~Back to Work~ Wouldn't you know it... the spell checker recognizes "Pokémon
Oops! If, by some wierd twist of fate, you're a creditor, and your wondering where my credit card payments are... "Oops, I forgot... Incoming Money to You! "

I'm What? Late? No No No... I'm Early For Tomorrow! Seems like I've fallen into the same trap that many of my colleagues [ read: The slackers who's sites I linked to on the left ] and took a day or two off from my last post... reason? I didn't want to bore you. I seriously have very little going on right now in terms of gaming, fun, or living for that matter. I got to school, come home, and do homework, and occasionally I get to pick up my GBA: SP, and pound out a few hours of Pokémon. Which is still awesome fun, more so because I want to catch them all, and then smoke anyone I can get my hands on. Zelda has been shelved for the past week, only because I need a solid 4-5 hour block to sit down, and pick up all those damn treasure maps and other stuff, that I don't want to spoil for you. I can hear the wind howling outside, April 7th, and we're getting another 5-10cm of snow. Hey winter, summer called and he wants you to open the door and let spring in! This ultimately proves that the Groundhog knows dick, and that winter leaves, when winter wants to leave. So much for that whole global warming thingy. As you may or may not know, when it comes to my tech stuff, I'm pretty anal about it. Scratches on CDs, DVDs, Gameboys and DVD boxes are just some of the things that drive me crazy! I mean if I'm spending 50 bucks on a new game, I want the whole thing, right down the the instruction manual, to stay in perfect condition. " Be careful while your reading the manual, bend it an I'll kill you! - Common phrase uttered by me, I kid you not. Anyway, needless to say that a week and half of my GBA:SP running around without a case is driving me mad. So I turned to the one place I knew would have it all... Hong Kong! urlLink [ http://www.lik-sang.com ] is a great site for ordering accessories, and what not, for your gaming needs. For only $20US, I picked up a case, the headphone adaptor [ third party version ], and some screen covers, because the first scratch on a screen, always hurts more. I don't know how well they are going to end up working, but I'll let you know. Besides, they only cost 2 bucks. If you haven't done so already, go buy some Super 7 tickets for this Friday, $30,000,000 tax free dollars... what are you waiting for? Go Go Go! [ by the way, if you buy them because of this post, and then win... I have a very costly Video Game hobby that could use sponsoring...] Well, hope the wait was worth it, maybe I even got you to smile... Thanks for continuing to read, as I enjoy writing. ~Fisheezy Outtie~ Hmm, its adaptor, not adapter? Thank you IESpell

Back To My Roots! Shit it's been way too long. Thanks to those who are still reading, I know it's only been like 4 days, but when you used to update daily, 4 days is a long time. Work just takes the excitement out of your life! So anyway, I've decided I'm going to update 3 times a week, guaranteed, on Monday, Thursday, and Sunday nights. I'll try and do more, but I'll be sure to post on those nights so you, my loyal readers, don't come here expecting something, and find nothing. On the gaming front, I picked up Wario Ware, Inc. for my GBA. Out of ten, I'd have to give it an 8. There is a lot of fun in this game, especially if you're like me and you really enjoy Mario Party type games. Basically the game consists of completing little "microgames" one after another. The Catch? The games only last about 5 seconds, and they give you very little instruction on what you have to do. For example it says "Catch" and then this ball flies at the screen while you control a little guy with a huge ass baseball glove. That's one of the easier ones. It's fun, maybe you can borrow it when I'm done :P In other gaming news, over the past 3 months or so, I've been invited into this Gamer Advisory Panel [ G.A.P. heh! ] by Sony. According to them I have the ability to shape the future of gaming... They're pretty hardcore about it too, I got a little card, and a Certificate [ similar to the one a doctor gets ] that proves my involvement. I'm not sure of the benefits of it, or exactly how many people got in, and what the criteria was for it. However when the card and certificate say I'm an "elite member" and I never had to apply, I wonder how they know what kind of gamer I am. None the less, I'll keep you informed. Movies..... I saw The Italian Job last night. Great movie, not as good as the Matrix, but that goes without saying. Other than the fact that a few of the scenes had some pretty bad continuity errors, [ I.E. a car with supposedly 1000 Lbs of weight in the back... tilts forward in the air. Then again, it's a movie ] it was a movie worth paying for.

Enough About SARS Already Ok, with all due respect to those who lost the ones they love... I've had enough with this SARS bullshit. YES, it is a very contagious and potentially fatal illness. YES you need to be clean, and stay away from hospitals unless absolutely necessary. YES you have a 1 in 1,350,000 chance of dieing from SARS in Toronto. To put that in perspective, you have almost 3 times greater odds of dieing in a plane crash. 5 times greater of being killed driving home from work. So to all you bands and tourists who are using SARS as an excuse. Here's a big Fuck Off! I don't want your album anyway. [ *cough* Stained *cough* ] Furthermore, in the Washington D.C. area, someone is shot every 55 minutes. I don't see the World Health Organization [ WHO ] telling you not to go there. Yet 27 out of 4 million people die from a virus, and Toronto [ and Area ] are the worst place to travel! Next to China of course, because SARS is there waiting to attack you as you get off the plane. Don't get me wrong, it's a problem that needs the attention of the people of Toronto. We need to be aware of the disease, it's causes, preventive measures, it's symptoms and potential effect on us. However to cause the hysteria the world is causing over it is stupid. I've been living my life the same way I have been the past 15 years I've lived here, I've had the flu during that time, and I'm still here! Get with it! Unless you plan on visiting your friend who has SARS, or you don't wash your hands before every meal, and after every piss, I don't think you have anything to worry about. Unless you make the local hospitals your stomping grounds! Anyway, this is probably directed at the people who will never read this, but I figure I put this site here to gripe, and dammit I'm gonna gripe! Peace!

General Stupidity Hockey Night in Canada... Sitting here watching game seven. Great game so far. It's probably going to take me awhile to type this out. Anyway, I been really busy this week, getting used to this 7:30 - 3:30 shift. [ Wild just tied the game ] I heard a few things on the radio this week that I wanted to mention. The worst was this stupid school trustee who thinks that the Don Cherry Molson Bubba commercials should be pulled from the air because he's a role model for children, and is promoting under age drinking or some crap like that. I'm not sure how, but apparently she's one of those parent's who's kids get hammered week in and week out, just because it's cool. Her actual excuse was that her 12 year old was walking around singing the song... so WHAT? Where in that song does it say "Drink Beer even if you are under 19"? I just think it's fucking stupid to make a huff about that. Kids, especially boys, are gonna grow up, get hammered at a friend's house and they are going to do it regardless of who is singing! Be it Don Cheery or Ru Paul. Moving forward... A Utah man was rock climbing in a canyon when he fell, and had a 1,000 lbs boulder roll on top of his arm. After five days af lying there with no help, he decided to take out his pocket knife and remove his own arm above the elbow. It gets better. He ties a tourniquet and then repels [ with one arm ] down to the bottom of the canyon, where he then proceeds to hike 8 KMs to get help. Now I don't know about you, but I know I don't have the balls to cut off my own arm, never mind the repelling and the hiking [ Wild Take the Lead ]. Anyway, I'm gonna finish watching the game.

Ba Ba Garbage Man, Three Bags Full I was standing outside today, and saw my neighbour putting the stickers on his extra garbage bags... for those of you who don't know what I'm talking about, in Mississauga, you are only allowed to put out 3 garbage bags, anything after three needs a special sticker on it. These stickers cost $0.10 each. The idea being they can make more money off you, on top of taxes. Here is why I think this is stupid... fine charge us, because after all the world does make too much garbage, but charge us more for the bags... don't be stupid and limit the number of bags you can put out. Here is where that idea is flawed. Neighbour A has 4 bags of garbage this week, and neighbour B has 2... Neighbour A drops one bag of garbage off at neighbour B's and then no one pays a thing, and all he had to do was walk across the lawn to his neighbour's. I mean, unless your entire neighbourhood has a hard-on to making you pay an extra dime, someone is bound to not give a shit if you put a bag of garbage on their curb, beside theirs... after all it's gone the next morning anyway! The entire idea makes no sense, I'd be interested to see how much money the program is making. There must be a lot of stupid people in Mississauga, I mean how often do you have 3+ bags of garbage a week anyway? The odd time you do, fuck the sticker, just take a look at your closest neighbours, one of them is bound to have some vacancy on the curb for your outcast garbage bag! Anyway,,, peace!

GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOALLLLLLLLLLL Today was probably the most exciting sporting moment I've ever been involved in! Left [ my indoor soccer team ] played our first playoff game today, against the cockiest bunch of guys, with the LOUDEST group of screeching women. As it went, the women got to screech early as the put a goal in, about 7 minutes into the game. Defencive breakdown on our part [ I wasn't on the floor :) ]. Anyway, nothing changed until about 5 minutes left in the game... 1 - 0 in indoor soccer is pretty crazy, we weren't getting the shots through. Anyway, with about 5 minutes left, it looked as though we had tied it up when all of a sudden one of their players jumped toward the ball rolling into the net, and literally picked it up, and threw it out of the net... no call! I was livid! About a minute after that, Clive called for a line change, I hopped on to find the ball heading right at me. I knocked it down, carried it in, dished it off, and went for the net, but I wasn't needed. The forward I passed it to faked a shot, and passed it off to the left winger who calmly put it home... tie game! Now 1:37 left in regulation and my worst nightmare happened. They scored again! I thought for sure it was over. I was wrong. With about 25 seconds left, we tied it up, and headed for Overtime. Golden Goal rules... first goal wins! They were all over us, but our defence held strong, and when the opportunity came, off a free kick, the same player who tied it with 25 seconds left, ripped home a rebound for the win, and we went nuts! It was pretty exciting, and all this with a fever close to 100! I'm not sure what it was, but once the game started, I had nothing. I couldn't stay on more than a minute, and it hurt to run. My grandma joked about SARS, but it's like a normal fever, no cough, no headaches, no muscle aches, no breathing issues. We'll see how I feel tomorrow morning, and if it's still pretty bad, I'll have no choice but to take the day off work, I don't want to risk if there is a small chance that it is. I'll be all over the news as the kid who infected a government office with SARS. On a final note, I send my apologies to my friends who I haven't been able to hang with in some time. I never realised how busy I've been getting this past month, committing to too much I suppose. Anyway, I look forward to a beer or two, and some video game playing soon. I'll buy! Peace!

Damn Computers! Still freaking out over these computers here. I'm not sure I could own a business putting these things together, what a pig! Anyway, I apologize for the lack of updates, just been one of those weeks, busy as hell and making no money! Today however, was a great way to wrap up the week. Hockey Day on Ridgeway: Part II I called everyone I knew, and everyone who asked why they didn't hear about the last one, and those that I got through to showed up, and showed up they did. With the addition of a shit-load of Stu's friends, we ended up playing 5 vs 5 with 2 subs, and I donned the goal tending equipment. I did a lot better than I thought I would, and enjoyed the fact that I didn't take a slap-shot to the marbles this week. One of the schmoes on the other team was just that... a moron. After we won the first game 3-2, and were switching nets he says "You guys will be back at that net fast... 5 minutes" with this gay smile on his face. You see we now had the smaller net to score on, and they had the bigger one. We promptly beat them in about 10 minutes, 3-0. So as we were switching back, one of my teammates asked me the time, and in earshots range of the moron, I said "About 10 minutes after we headed down to the other net." I think he deserved a comment like that. He started being a jackass, slashing, pushing, and calling me a fag just because he looked stupid for opening his mouth in the first place. When we play again, I'm pretty sure he wont be invited, I can't stand whiners! Anyway, all that out of the way, I did have a great time, and I'm drained, 4 Hours of hockey is a killer. A few guys on the other team were really good, and at the same time, nice guys. My philosophy is we're all out there to have fun, and we all gotta work on Monday, so chill out! Right? Maybe I'm just a wimp! Saw X2 : X-Men United yesterday, great movie. It makes a lot more sense if you know the X-Men story, otherwise you'll be left with the wrong impression. I'd have to say it's similar to Spiderman, enjoyable, but nothing spectacular. If you're into those movies. Go see it, otherwise save your money, the action isn't worth $13.50. I'll leave it at that, I'm tired, sore, and my TV is calling me names for neglecting it! ~out~

We Were Soilders I just finished watching this movie... and it was one of the hardest movies I've ever watched. The truth about war is painful, it's sad, and it's very real. This movie reminds us of that, and a lot more. The brotherhood, the patriotism, and the extream loss, but leaves you asking one thing... What is it all for? To anyone who has fought for whats right... Thank you!

Finally Well, with less than 5 minutes left in our 7th game of the year, I finally got on the score sheet. That's not to say I haven't been playing well, it's just you have to get used to playing mid-field, and not cracking home the goals, but instead just putting them up there for someone else to put home... which if I do say so myself, I've done pretty well! If they counted assists, I'd have at least 6 or 7 by now. Anyway, enough gloating... I haven't done much in the past few days, hit Canada's Wonderland yesterday for the first time in about 5 years, had a good time, but damn was it hot! Oh yeah, and Best Buy still hasn't called about my TV Stand. I don't meant to gripe on and on about this, but when you're system can't process simple things like ordering a TV stand, there is a problem. As the customer I shouldn't have to go in 5 times to check on the status of something that is sitting in a warehouse in Brampton. [ which I offered to go pick it up at! ] My friends, you can get just as good a deal on your TVs and whatnot at other stores, without the clueless Best Buy employees. If they give me something for my troubles, then I'll probably continue shopping there, because when they screw up again, I know I'll have something coming, otherwise I'll take my business somewhere else [ including the TV I already have, if I can get them to take it back... why should they get my hard earned money? ]. Blogging is beginning to feel natural again, perhaps I should do this more often? TTFN TTFT!

A Bowl of Lucky Charms and some Time It's been a long ass time. So much for constant updates. To be totally honest, the last thing I want to do after a long day on a computer, is come home and use... the computer. Anyone I had reading this is probably gone now, but thats cool, I'll work at getting this back up, and then get the readers back. I'm in another fight with Best Buy. Taking them over a month to get a TV Stand from Brampton to Oakville... don't ask! On top of that, I actually thought about working there, till the stupid manager gave me attitude. We sat down to start the interview, and she starts asking all these dumb DOS / BIOS questions that the PC does automatically 90% of the time. If you're messing with that shit, then you don't bring your PC to Best Buy! Anyway, she asks me; "What are IRQ 3 and 4 used for" "Heh... Sound Card? I don't know the BIOS does that for me... people actually have these problems here?" [ cue the bitch's attitude ] In the most stuck up, snobby voice she looks up from the book that these questions are in and says... "It's general PC knowledge" "Yeah... when you have a book with the answers in front of you" She laughed it off, but I could tell that was it...She asked a few more questions, like what is used to create a boot disk in DOS, and how do I partition a disk. Then she asks me what I can do for Best Buy. Remember I'm pissed at these morons about my TV Stand, so I told her that I had better Customer Service skills than 90% of her employees, and that it was the weakest part of Best Buy. Then she thanked me and said I'd hear from her in the next few days... funny the phone never rang. Ah well, such is life. Anyway, CCRA is keeping me busy, then soccer, and of course "my Jenny!" Among other plans I have, once again I'll pledge to write more often, but who knows if I can keep up with it. You need the will to sit down and type, and my new HD Terminal, HD TV, and DVDs keep my ass pretty glued to the couch! Peace!

Router Land is Hell Well as we all know, the world is going mobile, and the Internet is no different. So this week my girlfriend as well as one of my mom's friends decided to go wireless around their house. So I looked around and found what I thought was a sweet deal on a D-Link wireless G router, only 80 bucks! Well thats where all hell broke loose! This was possibly the worst router I've ever tried to work with! I consider myself above average with these things, but I couldn't get to the router's config page. I brought the router to my house, to see if maybe it was a windows 98 issue, but nope! Both Win2K and XP couldn't connect! Anyway, to make a long story short, I went through 3 D-Link Routers, and decided to go with my original idea. Linksys! I'll let you know how that goes. For now... it's off to see PT try to come back from 9th in todays CART Denver G.P. Exprerience counts my friend. Age and wisdom comes later.... - Unknown

Keep on, Keeping On It's been a few days, but I've been a pretty busy guy. On my own accord, but busy none the less. On the initially planned release day of arguably the biggest game of the year, Half Life 2, I've got some gaming stuff to touch on today, so here I go! I've managed to get my hands on a few new games over the past week or so, and I'm glad i did. F-Zero GX, NHL 2004 [PC], Final Fantasy Tactics Advanced all of which are solid games but the online features of NHL 2004 has earned it more playtime than the other 2. EA has provided a match-making service, that tracks wins and losses, rankings, etc. Lets face it, stats are the reason we like these games. I don't care much if I'm winning or losing all the time, but that fact that is a plus for me none the less. As for offline, the game has improved 10-fold on 2003. With Dynasty mode which lets you take a team through a 20 year period, and raise the team from a garbage basement dwelling team, to the Stanley Cup as the team's GM. Easier to do it on Easy difficulty, but I'm sure Difficult is gonna kick my ass. urlLink [ GunBound.net ] was just brought to my attention, I'm not exactly sure what it is, or how it works... but it's worth checking out, I'll let you know how it goes when I know! I'm out! Good breeding consists in concealing how much we think of ourselves and how little we think of the other person. - Mark Twain

But sw0rdfish... whatever has gotten you in a huff this time? Well let me tell you! Today I get my new PC Gamer [ better than "Nudy Magazine Day" ] so i rip open the plastic, and put the CD on my desk to be tested later, when what do I see ..... not the cover NOOOOOO a half cover with the word "Advertisement" on the top.... Immediately I think... "new CPU chip?, HL2, Doom 3?? ATI 9800 Super Duper Deluxe with Bells and 3 Whistles!!!?? [ I mean common ... this is the COVER or PC Gamer.. this has to be HUGE!!!! ] what is it...... N-Gage...... well **bleep** you! I don't buy PC gamer to be inundated with BS handheld that aren't worth 1/6th the money they want for it, let alone the fact that it has nothing to do with my PC Games... I fully understand the concept of advertising = money, however who in their right mind gave the go ahead at Nokia to pay for this? PC gamers don't care about Overpriced Phones w/ sub 8Bit graphics, when I can get a GBA:SP, and a brand new Samsung for half the price! I think PC gamer should do some thinking before 1 selling out for money, and 2, giving something of this nature that much exposer.... no it's not a review, but if you advertise something, you should believe in it... at least just a little, everyone knows this phone isn't worth it's weight in sperm donations, so why the hell put it on the front so that your readers think it's a good idea to buy. They did an injustice to their readers, and dammit! they're going to hear about it from me! [Over-reacting.... maybe.... but I'm pissed dammit! ] Talim, Believe in Yourself - Talim, Soul Calibur II

Piracy Hurts Me Too! Here's the problem, and I've had to deal with it TWICE in the past 3 days... No I'm not going to yap about how Microsoft only gets 10 Million a year and loses 5 Million to piracy... because I don't care! Let me explain. On Saturday I visited Wal-Mart and picked up EA Sport's Madden 2004. For some reason, I picked up the notion that I knew what they hell was going on in football, other than the fact that a field-goal is 3, and a touchdown is 7... Well 6, but whatever! After about halfway thru the 1st game, I was down 52 - 0, and I was thinking. " You Fucking Idiot! " and herein lies the problem. I'm stuck with a product that I don't like... mind you it's my fault, but I don't like it. I should be able to go back, and spend my 60 bucks on something I like! If I buy a TV, and I don't like it... I can take it back. Radio? Take it back! PC!!! Take it back! However, Video games and underwear... tough shit! This is of course because people are buying games, copying them, and then returning them. Thanks to all you moron's who treated EB and Gamestop like a Blockbuster! So... I happen to be very persistent when I'm not satisfied with something. I marched back into Wal-Mart, and told them my situation [ less than 24 Hours later ] and that there was no way I could play this game. It took a bit of talking, waiting, and a meeting with the district manager, but he agreed to let me exchange the game. So, I walked out with NHL 2004, all for the Cube BTW. Get home, played NHL for about 6 hours, and scored on average 9 goals in a 5 Minute game. Unfortunately, the other teams averaged about 15. I don't know if this is a trend in all the versions of NHL 2004, but the goaltenders are freakin useless! My defence men were taking pucks off the line more than my goalie. It was sad! Scoring from center, scoring from behind the net, scoring off back passes! Well, I did it again. Sorry but I refuse to spend that much money, on a shitty product. Almost any product, if you aren't satisfied with it... you're going to return in. Gaming industry has the advantage of, once you buy it... it's yours, unless you go through hell and high water to get it returned. I had to fib this time, but I got them to take it back, and walked out with F-Zero GX. Now I know what is in your head. "Why didn't you rent the games?" and the answer is simple. By the time the game is available to be rented, something new will be out, and I'll have missed the boat. New video games are one of the hardest things to get your hands on at Blockbuster, so as much as it sounds like an option, it really isn't! With the no-return clause, and the ability to patch. I think we, as gamers, are getting duped into buying an unfinished product. Sure maybe after 4 patches it's a great game, but the fact that this hyped game is gonna sell a TON, and we know they can't return it... it doesn't have to be completely ready, lets just get it out in time for the next big day, and we'll worry about it after. Sad thing is, lots of gamers are ok with that. They take it in stride, they accept and know that "The patch will get it" and they continue to do it! I don't really know what can be done about this, but if I was the owner of a video game store, I'd say "Want the ability to return it? No problem, sign up for our card, and we'll let you do it... until we notice you're doing it too much, then you can go somewhere else!" Of course EB sells their games already open because they are too cheap to buy door sensors, but that’s another story. Pre-opening the boxes so you can display them. Meh. I'm done!

Isabel She's Heeere!... and I think she forgot to bring that "storm" everyone was talking about. There is something wrong with Torontonians, and storms. I think we have an extreme fear of them or something. 50KM/Hr winds, 50mm of wather... What the hell are you all scared about. The media around here was all hyped on "The Ruminants" of Isable... give me a break. It was a rain, and it fell... oh yeah, and there was some wind. When we get something in comparison to Carolina, or Washington then I'll worry, otherwise spare me the 15 minutes of hype on the news broadcast, and give me more sports. This is why I watch and read urlLink [ Canada.com / CH Network ] . They tell it like it is more than most. Out of the 5 channels I caught news, they were the only channel I heard the meteorologist say "I don't know what all this fuss is about" I'm getting really sick of the media hyping everything like this. Hype hypable stuff. You know storms that will rip my roof off. The USA getting ready to bomb Canada. John Lennon comes back to life for one more show. Speaking of hype, gamespy is up to their stupidity once again. Putting games like Mario Sunshine, Donkey Kong Country, and Halo on a list of 25 most overrated games. DONKEY KONG COUNTRY? Idiots. You Don't Know Joe! Not since Survivor one, have I been this immersed in a "Reality Show"... then again, this isn't really a reality. urlLink [ Joe Schmo ] is a show on Spike TV, that mixes Big Brother with The Truman Show to create a fantasy world for one guy, who has no idea he's being played. As of now, the show is three episodes in, and I've loved every minute of it. It's something new, and it works. Basically they took this guy, told him he was going to be a reality show, and then they put him in this house with 9 actors he thinks are other contestants, and they film his every waking second. Tuesday's at 9:00PM EST if you're interested. It then re-runs that week's episode a few more times during the week, so you can still catch episode 3 [ the best so far ] sometime this week! And that’s all I have to say about that! The proof is the proof! - Jean Chretien

Three's Company... Two Just isn't the Same I must say, when I first heard about the passing of John Ritter, I took it like just another celebrity death. However, the more I read about it the more I realised what a loss this truely is. John Ritter was truely a funny comic with a love for his job, a love for his life, and above all, still had a lot of living to do. I grew up watching Three's Company with John playing Jack Tripper and if I'm not mistaken he did the voice of Clifford the Big Red Dog! Personally I loved his new show, I don't get to watch much TV, but when I got a chance to, I'd watch. Thanks for the laughs John. Godspeed. 1948 - 2003 "It’s like there is a big tear in the world’s heart. He was extraordinary in every aspect of his life, especially as a father. His children were there at every moment of his life.” - Henry Winkler on John Ritter

Now You Can Help Fight Cancer! I'm sure you've all heard of Seti @ Home. The program that helps to find Extra Terestrials using your CPU when you're not using it... Well, Stanford University has done a simillar thing, only they're helping to fight cancer. urlLink Folding @ Home is a program that simulates the folding of protein in an attempt to figure out what causes "misfolding" in protein which have a hand in the cause of cancer, parkinsons, Alzheimer's etc... The idea is that this type of information would take forever on one or two machines. However the program spreads the work over millions of home machines and uses CPU down time to simluate this data. You can read more about it on the site, it's obviously more accurate. If you download it, you can join team "33686" and work on protein folding as a team. It tracks your status, and how much work you've done, as well as how much work your team has done... Anyway, I should pay attention to the teacher now! Samsonite!!! I was WAY off - Loyd Christmas

Sheridan College Thinks 40 So I'm in class the other day and our teacher makes the offer that if we'd like to switch to the other campus, Trafalgar, that we could talk to him. My initial thought was " Whoa!! Lots of people failed out in Trafalgar!!! and then the teacher said something that struck me as odd. He said that the other classes in Trafalgar were left as 15 people in each class because thats enough for 2 classes, but we don't have enough... Ummm, there are like 40 people in our class!!! Keeping in mind, that at the begginging of August, I wasn't even registered for school [ Sheridan's fault, not mine ], and I know I wasn't the only one. Then today when I was switching to the Trafalgar class, Mupiel made a crack about being registered so late, and the receptionist's comments were " Don't even go there!" ... And thats when it hit me! They didn't expect this many students at Brampton... because they fucked up and didn't register us! Being the lazy slob that Regina Persad is... she probably saw 15 people registered, said " We only need one CST class at Brampton this semester " Not even wondering why a bunch of people weren't comming back. So Sheridan hires enough staff for one CST class, and then the calls start comming in, and they go "oh oh!" but can't do anything to fix it, because they couldn't offer the teachers full times jobs in July, they probably all went somewhere else! So there you have it... We'll call it the Sw0rded Theory and I'd be willing to put money down on this is what happened! I should be a detective!~ Lieutenant sw0rdfish.

Don't you wonder what war veterans think of all these games being made about their best friends dying? That kinda bothers me. iTunes, do you? - Conski from Gamespot

I'm wondering when WWII became popular again. I know for the longest time in the 80's and early 90's WWII games were limited compared to other kinds. The movies focused on war in Vietnam and little WWII stuff (the holocaust in particular was a major story background) but the actual battles themselves were the stuff of high school history class. It seems strange that as video games become more realistic the popularity of WWII grows. Is there some secret longing to be a part of this gruesome war or is it the balanced battles and complex strategic gameplay that the limited technology of the weapons allows for. Next in the Mix: urlLink Call of Duty . I'm still a major urlLink PlanetSide fan, more than even BF1942. Oh well. I guess its more like I'm looking forward to the wars we'll be battling in the future. Good WWII movies and TV (in my opinion): Life is Beautiful, Band of Brothers, The Thin Red Line, The Longest Day, and The Bridge on the River Kwai (and The Geat Escape -- added @ 4:49pm). I saw urlLink 28 Days Later yesterday. Not so much scary as the previews make it out to be, but very intense and thrilling. I highly recommend it.

Who really wants to watch shakey copies of amazing films on crappy DVD's? I was reading urlLink this article on urlLink CNN.com and was thinking it would be a waste of my money and time to buy this crap. Though I do understand why people would watch it given that in China they will not see it for months after its North American release. What I really don't get is people who are impressed with themselves for downloading the movie off the net a couple days after its release. Worse than the quality of the pirated discs, why would I want to watch the movie on my 17" (or 19" or whatever you have) monitor when I could see it on a 25 FOOT big screen for 12 bucks (or IMAX for urlLink The Matrix:Revolutions )? Speaking of urlLink CNN.com , I am horribly annoyed that I cannot watch clips of their news programs on the web. I pay for cable TV at home and watch all their damn commercials, ISN'T THAT ENOUGH FOR THE MONEY SUCKING LEECHES!?!?!? Its like the idea of paying for radio. Free things that people feel they could make more money on. Why not charge a fee for me to ride my elevator at home and then stick adds up on the wall I'm required to read before exiting? Why not bill me on the amount of air I breathe? And while you're at it, make sure that ads are being pumped into my dreams while I sleep. YAWN! I slept well, now I need some tasty Tim Hortons Coffee to start my day off right, cuz I always have time for Tim Hortons.

After the Leafs got a lucky win Saturday, Montreal returned to it's winning ways last night, soundly defeating the Detroit Red Wings, while those "Awesome" Leafs took an ass kicking to the .... New York Islanders... I'm looking forward to Thursday when Montreal shows the Leafs how kicking a team's ass is done! About Saturday, biases aside, Montreal deserved that game. Toronto needs to desperately step up that Power-Play, 1 for 7 is NOT good. Belfour stole the game, which is what he's paid to do, then again Theo had to be sharp at spurts to keep Montreal in it. All in all though, it was an awesome game, until the Leaf fan's started acting like they won the cup... The day drivers in this country figure that out, the faster we'll all get home. Driving home from Ottawa today, I encountered every type of driver imaginable... The List The Speed Demon - This driver goes crazy at speeds faster than 120KM, which is fine with me, it's the erratic driving at that speed that I find stupid. Pull up within 2 feet of my bumper, at over 130KM/Hr, I'm not going to pleasantly move... come up behind me, I'll see you're faster... then I'll move. WannaBe Speed Demon - This driver thinks he's the fastest person on the road, drives 120 in the fast lane and doesn't move!!! The Confused Sunday Driver - This Driver drives 80 - 100KM/Hr in the passing lane... all the time! Cloud 9 Driver - Forget's he's driving, maybe eating, singing, or thinking.... sometimes putting on make-up... going 120.../shrug The Driver's Driver - [Yes I made that word up ] This Driver knows driver Etiquette... left lane I pass, right lane to drive. Tailgating does no one any good. Quick High-Bean flashes from well back should do well. Still not moving? Pass on the right, shake your head, and move on The Moron - No matter what, you're in his way, and he's right. This driver doesn't move for faster traffic, and if you give him the "Please move high beam" he simply replies with the Bird. Usually a Road Rage committee, don't piss him off or his engine may be in your back seat. There are more, and I tend to wonder from Driver's Driver to Cloud 9 Driver, but on the highway, I think I'm a great driver. Stick to the Right, pass in left lane... is that a hard concept? I'll talk about the game in Montreal later today, but it was a great game, very loud... too bad Toronto won, but they deserved the win, they took less penalties. Peace!~ A bird in hand is worth two in the bush. - No Idea

Not for losing the game, fuck that, its only a game. 95 years or not, in the end they're all a bajillion dollars richer, so they win anyway. Where's my million a year? Don't expect me to cry because you haven't won a world series in 95... no wait... 96 years. I blame them for the abuse this kid is taking. Not one Cubs player has come out and said "He's not the reason we lost. We lost because the Florida Marlins played relentlessly and they kicked our ass when it counted." Yes they've made side comments, but none of them have come and flat out excused the fan. ESPN and Fox had to do that for them. Whatever, baseball sucks lately.

Now its been on the news repeatedly for the last two days: the kid who screwed up the chances of the Cubs to go to the World Series. I don't follow baseball, honestly, I actually only enjoy going to a game to eat peanuts and toss the shells on the ground ( its the slob in me ), but this news piece caught my attention. I'm not going to reply to the thought that the Cubs were unable to win because they just weren't good enough ( they did have seven games to try ) because urlLink Wil Wheaton already did a good job of that. My blog is for the unrelenting news media. Its most likely that the team wasn't going to blame their ENTIRE loss on this kid as no sane individual could hold a moronic grudge like that for long but the media keeps dragging it out. Since they lost game seven maybe we won't hear about it anymore but I doubt that will stop them. It will likely be a topic throughout the World Series. It just bugs me to hear the same news topic over and over again blown completely out of proportion. Maybe I just need more sleep. I'm whiny. As an added note today, since I'm always pissed at the news, especially CNN, I thought I would include the news stories that annoy me on a daily basis ( according to CNN.com ) -- Today : Europe is a big place with millions upon millions of people living there and this is their number one story for the continent: urlLink English fans sent home after fight

So, as some faithful readers may know, my wife is pregnant with our first child. I've been listening to a large amount of pop music lately as well. The reason these two things collide is a third ... uh... thing -- my soon to be purchased Mini-DV camcorder. I have these plans for home movies: complex directorial scene design, composition, editing, effects and most importantly, sound editing. I really like to add soundtracks to the work I do... it has always driven my writing (plays and things) and has infiltrated my cinegraphic desires as well. Now this blogging has actually nothing to do with my DV desires (except for that last paragraph). More so, all these movie ideas have me feeling excited, yet, anxious about fatherhood. Imagine, me, a dad. I mean, I will love being a Dad... but I always thought my dad was so " Cool ". Of course he wasn't cool (what dad is?) but he liked the coolest things. Now some little youngster, my little one, is going to look up to me (hopefully). Whats my point? I just think it seems weird, I mean I can barely tie my OWN shoelaces.
