IN FLANDERS FIELDS the poppies blow Between the crosses, row on row, That mark our place, and in the sky The larks, still bravely singing, fly Scarce heard amid the guns below. We are the Dead. Short days ago We lived, felt dawn, saw sunset glow, Loved and were loved, and now we lie In Flanders fields. Take up our quarrel with the foe: To you from failing hands we throw The torch; be yours to hold it high. We don't forget!

I just purchased the urlLink TV Wonder VE card from ATI for my PC. Here's my VERY summarized review: Nice picture quality with a ton of features. Being able to search through upcoming programs easily by Genre, or Name and even by Actor is really cool. Recording seems to be a simple procedure but requires a fair bit of troubleshooting on my system. I have to wait to see how the output will look when returning the image to my television or buring it to VCD & DVD. Other than that, its real handy have TV in the bedroom though I need a better coax cable. So much noise on my signal, especially on urlLink Spike TV . With some pay-pal money that I stored away for just such an occasion, I picked up Super Mario Advance 4 for 25 Bones! Pretty sweet deal if you ask me! Anyway, I started playing it, and decided I'd first go through it level by level, and skip the flutes and stuff.... so off I went. I was amazed at how many of the little tricks and secrets I actually remembered [ hidden mushrooms, and 1UPS, as well as the card flipping game trick ] and I haven't played this game in well over 10 years. Crazy if you ask me... why can't I remember algebra and physics like that? My hunt for a NES and SNES continues. If you have either, and don't mind parting with it. Let me know. Included in that list of "What Fish Wants" is an E-Reader to borrow, so I can scan some cards in to my GBA:SP... again, if you have.. tell me! I'm out! Oh and Mupiel... you complain more than I do... well maybe not. I know you're out there. I can feel you now. I know that you're afraid. You're afraid of us. You're afraid of change. I don't know the future. I didn't come here to tell you how this is going to end. I came here to tell you how it's going to begin. I'm going to hang up this phone, and then I'm going to show these people what you don't want them to see. I'm going to show them a world....without you. A world without rules and controls. Without borders or boundaries. A world where anything is possible. Where we go from there, is a choice I leave to you. - If I have to tell you... you're dumb!

Quick stint of bitching here: I was reading reviews as a preview to The Matrix: Revolutions on urlLink Rotten Tomatoes and was really annoyed. I don't know why I read reviews anymore but I am always surprised how many reviewers HATE sequels. I only read reviews to get an idea of content now not to get the reviewers impressions. I don't mind if people use this as a means to decide whether or not to go see a film but I'm annoyed when people tell you how they didn't like a movie cuz a review said this and that and then they agreed with them. Go see the film and then tell me what YOU think. I say skip the reviews, go to the film (or download it or whatever) and then bitch about what sucked and then read reviews. I just despise mass media more every day. By the way I'm going to see The Matrix tomorrow (if you couldn't tell).

Many of you know.... or don't know.... I love Cookies!! I can eat cookies forever! Lunch, Dinner.... maybe breakfast! If they're hot! So today I hit the cupboard, and I see a bunch of cookies.... but one catches my eye! urlLink Imagine my surprise when I opened up the bag, to find a cookie exactly as depicted on the bag!..... NOT! urlLink Mr Christie... you cheap bastard! Where is my damn Peanut Butter chips? If you have to cut back on budget, and save some money, put a new fucking picture on the bag! I'm annoyed enough at this that I'm going to email or call Mr. Christie and his associates and tell them how disappointed I am with their false advertising. Am I really that annoyed that I didn't get my fair shake of chips or that they're ripping me off? No... not really. It's just another example of stupid corporate decisions that "save money" and they think "the stupid consumer won't notice". Well guess what! Fish noticed bitch! I'm going to have to find a word for my attacks on these big daddy companies... First Bell, then Best Buy, and then Bell again, and now Nabisco! On the topic of Best Buy... I found out how to get even. You know those flyers that come to your door? That advertise really cheap DVDs. If you walk into a Best Buy, and buy nothing but those DVDs on sale... They LOSE money. It's called the Loss Leader. They sell those DVDs at less than cost to get people into the store and hope that they then go and buy other products which they make a profit on. So it's my new ritual to shop at Best Buy for DVDs on their first few days, and then get anything else I want at another store! 'Nuff Said! If it's fair... it's gone! - Countless Baseball Announcers!

One more memeber to the Fish, Inc. pile! My dream is being realised.. In other news... Blogger.con and Blogspot.com are not addressable for lots of people because of a DNS snafu. (DNS are the computers that tell your computer what number to go to when you put in a name.) The fix has been pushed, but it could take a while to refresh everywhere. Meanwhile, if you're geeky, you can change your host file to get to Blogger (point new.blogger.com to 66.102.15.100). So basically you can't read this, which means that since it's been like this since before 7AM, Mupiel's updates never went through and dind't appear, which means I wasn't kicked off the front page, which means that I've still always been on the front page... Besides, this three day thing may need to get extended since we now have 4 bloggers...

I have been busy this holiday season and I wasn't able to wish all you Fish Incer's a Merry Christmas, Happy Chanaka, and the end of Eid (oh I almost forgot Quanza). I got some fancy gifts and I am sure some of you did too. Now I look forward to insane credit card debt and being broke for a few months to make up for what I lost this season. The girlfriend and I are planning an escape this week we don't know where we are going to go but it should be fun. I think we will pack and just drive and see where it takes us. As some of you know Mupiel, Sw0rdfish and I all play FFXI together. I also have my best friend playing the game. I came up with the idiot idea of leaving fenrir when we were low level to play on another server and we signed up for the world transfer (this is a bad subject with fish and mup). Once we got there it was what Fish said....Terrible. So we all left and went back to our old home. My friend Nappynix stayed there and has leveled his character to level 30 now. We visited over Christmas and he begged me to go back here and there to play so we could hang out online. I said I don't like Asura and I don't think I will be coming back ever. I thought about it last night while playing on fenrir. I couldn't find a group on fenrir so I said what the hell and I signed onto asura. I was in a group in 3 minutes of signing on. This guy said we were going to go kill the Treeants (a Holiday bonus quest) and I was into it. So he tells me we are going to join a huge alliance and take this thing on. I don't want to go into it but lets say a hour and a half later we didn't find his alliance, see trees, or do anything but run like &@#$ing morons for almost two hours. I have come to the conclusion that Asura is a server filled with retards, idiots, 12-year-olds, and other lowly beings of this nature. On a side note, I went back to Fenrir after that 2 hour waste of time and unlocked all my sub job quest items and I am only level 16. Surf looks good, I am out.

Another Christmas has come and gone. The driving all done, the food all eaten and the gifts unwrapped I settle in to a relaxing evening at home. As my wife was working I spent the last few hours alone, waiting for her shift to end but I did fill some of that time with a little FFXI and several glasses of cranberry juice. The time continues to tick down on the year and on my time before becoming a father. Christmas next year will have a completely new set of circumstances but at least I can cut out all the driving. As a note, my odometer hit 100,000 last night! Woo... do I get a cookie? Merry Christmas to all who read this and enjoy the holiday celebration.
Merry Christmas friends, family and casual readers! Hope Santa fills your stocking with lots of goodies!

So... As is customary the Saturday before every NHL Christmas break, Montreal Canadiens will take on the Toronto Maple Leafs in what is easily hockey's greatest and longest going rivalry... or is it? Without a doubt I love the 7 times a year these teams play, and it's because I've grown up being told to hate the Toronto Maple Leafs, and because I live in Toronto, where all my friends are told to hate the Montreal Canadiens. Now, he's my question... why? The last time Montreal and Toronto played a game that meant anything more than 2 points and bragging rights was 1967, since then it's been countless regular season meetings and thats about it. I have no doubt though, that when Montreal faces Toronto in a playoff series it'll all come to a head, and the fierce rivalry that we've all read and heard about will be reborn... and then the Habs will promptly show the Leafs the golf course ;)

A fine cinematic experience. The audience was a tad restless nearing the end, but they still managed to piece together an applause (why do audiences do this now? The movie makers can't hear you!!!) I actually felt like crap going into the movie (damn cough) and was drinking so much liquid to feel better that I had to step out to use the facilities 3 times in the 3 hours. I know, nobody actually needed to read that. Coming up after Christmas: urlLink Big Fish and urlLink Paycheck . I am not a fan of Ben Affleck but I am a HUGE reader of the excellent works of urlLink Phillip K. Dick and the news is that my favorite book by him, urlLink A Scanner Darkly , is being produced as well. Its an amazing story about drugs and multiple personalities, full of dark and edgy humour. As for Big Fish, you can rarely go wrong with anything by Tim Burton (I would link to his official site but apparently the " account has surpassed its bandwidth allocation "). Add to this the fact that one of the songs was done by urlLink Pearl Jam and I'm sold. For me, its like an anime (my favorite genre of film media) with angels (just cool factor for me here) -- urlLink Haibane Renmei . The media is finally catering to my needs and desires. It's about damn time too.

What a freakin game! Tonight's Habs vs. Predators game was probably one of the most exciting hockey games I've seen in ages! Scoring, hits, excitment... just needed a few fights. Ribeiro got 4 assists, and the Habs scored 4 powerplay goals... it's too bad Theo got hurt, hopefully not too serious. Some bad funks were ended by Montreal also... Souray had his first ever NHL hat-trick, and his 11th goal of the year [ tied for team lead ]. Oddly enough, entering this season, Souray only had 13 career goals. This was Montreal's first come from behind win when trailing after 2 in over 2 years. Next up, your Toronto Maple Leafs! *blarg* My car is fucked, freakin thing stalls all the time. we'll see what this is gonna cost me tomorrow. Peace out! I'm tired! Too Tired to Think of a Quote

Ok, lets get the California boy stereotypes out of the way... Yes, I say dude. Yes, I do surf. No, I don't look and act like Jeff Spicoli circa 1983 (Fast Times at Ridgemont High). No, I am not in a gang. No, I don't own a gun. No, my hair isn't blonde. No, girls in California don't look like the girls on Baywatch. Yes, I can wear shorts almost every day of the year. Yes, everyone in California has a cell phone (they issue them when you get your social security card now). No, I don't own a huge SUV. I am sure I forgot some of the stereotypes but I think you get the picture. A little back ground on me. I live near Anaheim (I am sure you Canucks know where that is since that is where Disneyland is and its home to a little known hockey team). I am a surfer. I used to race imports (I don't care what you saw on Fast and the Furious, its not like that). I met Sw0rdfish (AKA Pescado de espada) through Gamespot. He also tricked me into getting FFXI. Its ok, cause I love the game; I just get mad at all the time I waste playing it. Other then having a year round tan I am just like you guys (well that, and I don't say "eh..." at the end of my sentences; I say "Dude" instead). I think I have said enough so I will see you guys soon...

... but it's ok, because it's just a virtual world! urlLink The Alphaville Herald is a mock newspaper website that reports on issues going on in Alphaville, which is the virtual world that " The Sims Online " takes place in. Now apparently there are some naughty little girls, which might otherwise be of no surprise, however rumor has it that these "women" are under age. This, obviously, is where the problem lies... Personally I think its just some horny, lonely 50 year old fat guy, but even if it's not... I don't think it's up to Maxis to figure that out. If it is some little girl, or boy for that matter, isn't it up to that kid's parents to know what they're kid is doing? Sure you can say Maxis is providing the means, but how do you stop anyone from sending words to another person? After all thats all it is, two consenting people, sharing words. Who's footing the bill? Probably the kid's parents... I'd want to know what I was buying my kids. I've said it once, and I'll say it again. The only problem with video games is bad parenting!!! [ well, that and shitty developers ] I need more readers... "Some People Would Rob Their Mother For The Ends" - Everlast

Well, the dream of becoming Sheridan Intermural Indoor-Soccer champs ended today, at the hands of Metro United , the best team in the league... We did manage to keep it close, trailing 3 - 2 at half, but in the end our stamina gave out, and with our best player de-spirited and out of the line-up, we fell 7 - 3. I'll tell you one thing, I heard intensity and trash talking from urlLink Stugautz the likes I've never seen from him... Nor anyone on our team for that matter. Even with a score of 7 - 2 against us with three minutes to play, calls of " Oh YEAH!! Now WHAT?" and "Is that the best you can do" came from our keeper... Maybe it was the shots he was stopping with his head? Let me tell you... They hurt! I took one of the head, AFTER it hit the wall, and it still hurt! So props to Stu! To the rest of you guys, it was the best game we've ever had... We wanted it more... Just couldn't find the strenght. urlLink Yan and Clive... urlLink Waldo ... Thanks for two great seasons, was a fun ride, lets win bronze! Peace! GOOOOOOOOOOOOOAAAAAALLLL - Too Many People to List

No... Well Yes.... But No.... Ok? Holy crap it's crunch time, and unlike Mupiel, I'm feeling the crunch. Basically I have one week to decide the rest of my life!! Ok, not really, just the next three months. Pass 2 tests, and an assignment, and that's it. No more school forever! Fail anyone of those, and find yourself back here! I'm confident the "I don't give a hoot" attitude that some Sheridan teachers seem to have, will help me get past this final educational hurdle, and I'll be a free man come December 12th at 11PM... At which point I plan to get smashed. Alone if necessary, with friends would be ideal! No even though I'm stressing out, I haven't given up on games. I can't stay away from them, I'll probably play Sunday night, the day before " The Big Presentation " and then come in, and calmly walk my way through the presentation... I don't get nervous talking in front of people anymore... Especially not class mates I've had for the past 3 years. urlLink Final Fantasy XI continues to take up most of my time as far as gaming goes. However, on a trip to my local gaming store with Jen and her brother, I grabbed Ratchet & Clank [ the first one ] off the Greatest Hits rack... I still haven't played it On the topic of gaming, urlLink Penny Arcade has gone out and used the voice they have for some extreme good. They have started Child's Play, a program to buy gaming gear / systems / games, for sick children at a local Seattle Hospital. I can't help but commend this, and hope that I can somehow get involved. I'm going to try to help anyway I can, bring the program to the Toronto area... Because we need it here... Too bad we only have 2 readers... So now that I've pushed Mupiel's posts down, I'll say... Don't forget to go read it! It's rather Enlightening today! I'm Out! H! - Mupiel

I played Rockstar's newest creation for the Playstation 2: urlLink M A N H U N T . Firstly, I must admit to actually being somewhat disturbed by the violence. Secondly, I must admit to wanting to play more than I did. The subtlety in sound recognition is everything urlLink Splinter Cell SHOULD have been. Plus, with the USB headset this game is scary as hell. A dark voice barking you on to commit henious acts while you try not to say anything as the enemy will hear you. Sneaking up with a plastic bag in hand, holding down the X-Button long enough for the targeting to go red (the most vicious "execution") and then letting go to watch the over the top violent murder. Now, I am not normally the violent type but the game puts you in a situation where the character has to kill or be killed, so in some PSYCHO SERIAL KILLER sort of way, the mentality you get into from the peril and the ever present voice in your head makes the violence seem justifiable*. All in all it is a very well made game whether or not you agree with the mature content. The AI is strong, the characters actually talk to themselves when they think no one is around (and say some wierd "Rockstar Games" sort of stuff), learn from your skills, and become consistently more difficult to surprise. The sound is the key to the game though. You must sneak your way from shadowy corrider to shadowy corridor to make it through without engaging too many enemies at once. If I were a reviewer I would give it a number of stars out of like a bunch of stars. In other news, I saw urlLink The Lion King musical with my wife. I hate musicals, but the music was okay. And I had a Hagen Daaz ice cream bar on the break. MMMMMmmmmm..... I recognize the irony of this next comment but... Is urlLink this for real? Do people really think they need to support AMMO? There are people starving in America but more importantly AMMO Day is November 19. Where is America going? There is a suspiciously large number of self declared " right-wing " weblogs. * Disclaimer: Real violence is very rarely justifiable .

That snow just rocks! Of course is also owned my car. Proved once again that bald tires and snow are not a good match. I'm pretty sure we got about two or three feet of snow, which is really nuts when you think about it... That's enough to cover a toddler! I haven't much time to blog tonight, we have a deadline to meet tomorrow for our current project. Have I spoken of this yet? I'll have to re-read my past blogs. ... After reading my last blog quickly, it doesn't seem like I have, so I'll touch on it quickly. We got hired by a friend of my father to make a web application as well as a desktop application. I wont get into the specifics yet, because blogger and google are good friends, and I can't let any info get into the wrong hands. I know... I'm paranoid. Anyway, this application must interface with a database and store information [ duh! ] and retrieval blah blah... So! We decided to use ASP.NET for the web application and C#.NET for the desktop application, and I must say, I'm learning a lot, and I'm pleased with my new found skills. I've never been that into coding, although I do consider myself a pretty good one, if I apply myself. I'll provide more information when it becomes available, but I think I can get used to coding for a living. Now you're wondering... Who is we? Well, we is myself and Ryan, who is pretty good with this shit! Mupiel was involved as well, however he had himself a baby, and I guess he's a little busy. More should be coming on Adaptive IT soon... The future is looking pretty exciting, however some security would be nice. Fish OUT! By the way... The title... They were the birthday boys. Confusions :: Programming :: Rob Howard :: SAMS :: Friends

I've been playing a lot of GCN these past few days and would like to update you on my progress. Not that anybody cares, but I have nothing better to do than to blog this up... so ya. Let's start with Animal Crossing ('cause you know you love it :P): My town is still perfect (but improvements still can be made - according to the wishing well)... and Animals from my cousins memory card are moving over to my town rapidly... it's quite funny to see my cousin get mad that they are all moving away from his town and into mine :) I've got all kinds of fruits growing...coconuts, oranges, apples, pears, cherrys... I need peaches.... guess i'll just steal them from the fish when we have that LAN party...I messed up on the job the mayor gave me though - to turn on the lighthouse every day for 9 days... MK:DD!!: My cousin and I played the baby track (the plain oval) over and over in vs. mode for like 2.5 hours... that track is wicked fun!.. I'm still waiting for that LAN party to happen.. I know Yan will kick my ass, but I want to see if I can shut him up..haha. I have to get gold for the star and special cups in 150cc so that I can get the All Cup mode.... but havnt really been trying 'cause I like the multiplayer games and races better... and i'm nearing the staff ghost record for the baby track... I just need to shed like 1.5 seconds off my time. um.. that's it I guess ... oh wait... theres something else I wanted to rant about.. urlLink Final Fantasy: Crystal Chronicles for 39.99, When you buy a link cable This offer's valid at Futureshop and Best Buy It works out to be cheaper than the EB deal because you get a link cable which is 17.99+tax and then the game at 39.99+tax Why must these deals come out when I don't have the money to buy them?.. why?! ok.. im done. peace out.

Firstly, Congratulations to Mupiel! In approximately 13 years you will ponder the fact how a few seconds of pleasure can amount to so many grey hairs. Good luck! (Bonus points for not naming her Link) Then, how to host a murder. Take eight people, preferably with imagination or the balls to make fools out of themselves. Add dinner, costumes, a plot, and Voila! An evening filled with accusations and... puking. I was so drunk I can't believe myself, given the situation and people around me. The setting of the game was "western" so we were all cowboys and triggerhappies in true Bush style, I even had a southern twang to it, until the alcohol took it away. Then it was just a slur, I believe. That blasted Southern Comfort (yeah yeah) and cheap whiskey, if the host of the evening hadn't told me to help him get rid of it... I did it for the team! I remember someone, near the end, telling us all what a great bunch we all were, so I believe myself to not have been the only one drunk there. Actually, I know this for a fact, as I had to wait for my turn by the toilet. Enough of this, onwards and upward!

With the help of some person I met online (lives in Barrie), I set up Warp Pipe with my GCN/BBA/PC and we played a short, but working game. It lagged out after a period of time because of the connection, but still.. it worked :) Then today I helped Yan set up Warp Pipe and we started to test it out when my router got all fubared and started to go berzerk when it detected my GCN. An hour of troubleshooting and a firmware upgrade later, we were up and running! We raced a few races (Yan kicked my ass) and battled a few battles (we broke even there)... fun fun. What sucks about it though is that you cant select your own characters. In LAN mode, the game selects the characters and car for you... booo! So when it comes time (it better be soon... *cough*Sw0rdfish*cough*) to have our GCN LAN party, whomever is playing better be good with all characters 'cause you never know what you're gonna get :P I can't wait! Other than playing GCN all night, I downloaded a slew of N64 roms and was playing them all afternoon... I like how the PC monitor enhances the graphics: ...oh.. and I don't understand how people like MarioKart 64 more than MK:DD!!.. i mean.. wtf? I was playing it and was... um.. this sucks. I like the snes version better! ok... back to playing with the roms :) gah!... i have to pay attention to PoP!... i guess i'll do that instead :P pacs

So far, being a father is filled with WAY to much excitement. I am overwhelmed with all the good feelings. You just have this new little person in your life and loving them is automatic. You don't think " I have to love her because she's my daughter you just see her and you heart melts. There is a lot of nervousness as well though. She was born early at 34 weeks and 3 days and if my wife had gone to term she would have been over 10 pounds. Because she was early we have to leave her in the hospital nursery constantly and just visit occasionally. I find it hard to cope with being away even though I just met her. As for my video gaming: NBA Street Volume 2 is now 2 days overdue from Rogers Video. Think they'll understand? urlLink Talim (6mb .WMV)

From 7:30am until about 7:30pm today I sat in front of my computer and worked on updating urlLink my messageboard . Yeah. That's right, around 12 hours of php, css, mysql and html. Needless to say, I am happy with the result :) After that marathon of tweaking, my cousin came over and wanted to play some MK:DD!! That game has been taking up a lot of my time, but recently I've put it on hold 'cause unlocking everything is a mighty task and it gets very frustrating when you come so close to getting something, but lose at the finish line. However, without even noticing that I was winning, I was able to unlock Luigi's Mansion for battle mode (gold in the mushroom cup 150cc). Now all I have to do is get gold in flower, star and special (all 150cc) - That will give me The All Cup Tour... and then after that who knows...well, I do, but i'm not going to bore you with it. After MK:DD!!, he wanted to play Animal Crossing (it's his game, but I have it :P ). He hasn't played in 11 months - according to his townfolk. Now that game took up A LOT of my time... so I put it on hold and havn't touched it for a week now; but watching him play made me miss it and I'm probably going to play tomorrow. Why do I get suckered into these things?! I was kinda peeved that the animals had a New Years party without me. They didn't even tell me the location of the party! and by the time I found them (in a big group btw) the huge, colourful countdown sign had already hit 00:00 and all the animals were dancing and drunk. Don't worry... i'll be back tomorrow to clean up them weeds :) Alright. Enough already... I know. But I'll be back soon!.. oh yes I will. pacs

So after numerous atempts (at my life) i have finally dove into the tank. For those of you who don't know who i am, i don't care...go to hell, and for those of you that do...same goes to you. I make alot of spelling mistakes, deal with it if you want my posts to be perfect, i'll be happy to send them over to you so you can edit them. So yeah, i decided to join up with this blog, because i don't have any friends and i wanted to feel like i had a family. In other words, i didn't want to talk about video games in my own blog cause no one else gives a shit, but i figured everyone here would! This weekend is a perfect thing to have my blog about...what did i do you ask? For one, i had a 12 hour session of Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicals! And unlike ed, who is a chump, i played it multiplayer with 4 people! Umm the game is pretty good, it's definitly fun with four people, the battle system is easy and you can get back and forth from your spells and attacks with little trouble, which is key for a game like this. I also like how everyone has a different map on their screen. IE: one person gets the dungeon map, one guy gets the monster map, one the teasure map and the other guy gets scout..which gives you info on the enemy you are fighting. Another cool thing, all the artifacts you find in the dungeon you don't get to keep..which you might think is stupid, but at the start of each dungeon you have a bonus IE: don't use focus attack or Defeat enemies with spells. So you go through the dungeon trying to do that, and at the end of the dungeon everyones bonus is added up and whoever gets the most, gets first pick and one of the artifacts you found. So you do get to keep one. Another thing i liked...in single player you can fuse spells, (single player only...took me 4 hours to figure this out) but in multi player, you and other team member have to put you cross hairs together and then cast at the same time to fuse the spell, very good idea in my opinon. Anyways...there are somethings wrong with this game, they could have made it so much better. For one, the story is crap. Like i'm in the fourth year, playing for 12 hours and the story is the same...i'm still doing the same thing, talking to anyone is pointless and all the cut scenes so far have been pointless. They also didn't do a very good job of diversifying everyone. Pretty much every character is the same, you all pretty much get the same equpiment, everyone has the same spells and abilitys....shit making your character is one of the main things in and rpg...i don't know why they didn't put more effort into this. Oh well...seems like very game these days for gamecube has an awesome idea but they leave out so much that could have made the game perfect. Overall this is a good game, but if you want to play an awesome multiplayer rpg that does everything right, get Tales of Destiny for psx....remember though, DON'T PUT THE CHANNELING RING ON LEON! Anyways, other than that, i spent most of my time playing gunbound. I'm up to double steel axe now, i think i can join guilds at this rank...not sure. All aduka only shot 2 games are sweet, you make gold and gp super fast. Oh yeah...after almost 2 months..guess what finally showed up at my door?!? That's right Naruto 2!! Picked up my free loader today and i'm going to play it right after i finished writing this! which is now.

What an AMAZING game!... if I had the money i'd pick it up right away... but for now, I'll just play my cousins copy (we picked it up yesterday). I'm sure if you read any review on it you'll find that the graphics are amazing, the story is amazing, etc... and all of it is true... so i'll just talk about what I feel the game lacks in since there are more ups than downs... First off, there's this circle around you that protects you from the environment you play in. It gets quite annoying that you cant venture off away from the circle, and sometimes the circle messes up the graphics (because its there), but what can you do... oh well. You're also constantly running.. theres no sensitivity in the analog stick... so no walking/running... just running. um... the c-stick is useless in this game... so the views are automatically made for you...that sucks... but enough of the down falls... everything else is SICK! .. the music, the graphics, the Action RPG gameplay... sweet :) My cousins only complaint is that there are no ninjas in the game... this coming from a die hard RPG player.. go figure. I can't wait to try out the Multiplayer... actually... i'm going to go do that right now :P urlLink Kupo! Pacs... ALWAYS link the word urlLink Kupo! to the comic!!! Fish, Inc. Rules ;) - sw0rdfish

I was playing Hunter The Reckoning 2 Redeemer last night with some buddies on the Xbox. We were addicted to the first release - Hunter The Reckoning - and are addicted to this one as well. 4 player action shoot 'em up games are always fun to play :) ... one of the memorable moments in part one of this series is the teddy bear that becomes possessed, grows to a monster-like size and spews barf all over you as his weapon... along with jumping in the air and stomping... In part 2, he makes his return as Santa Claus' helper...yup... Santa becomes possessed and becomes monster-like... and we were surprised when he sent Teddy after us.. haha fun fun . I was wondering if anybody has played Hunter The Reckoning for the GCN. I've seen various screen shots online and it looks like they toned down the graphics... but I was wondering about the game play. Its going for like $20 new now since it was released in 2002 and I would like to pick it up, but I don't want to buy it and then be all disappointed when I find out by playing it that the graphics and game play got raped. Aside from Hunter; Friday and Saturday were spent playing Super Monkey Ball 2... fun party game, but the only game we played was Monkey Target 2 (glide your Monkey Ball to a target and land) .... Party games are a blast... but only if you have 3 or more people to play. There's a gaming trade-in, etc store like 2 mins from my house that we rented SMB2 from and I'm going to pick up a membership sometime this week 'cause it's only 2.99 to rent. They have a copy of Phantasy Star Online that I want to borrow so that I can configure my bba settings on the GCN and then test out the dev. tools people have created to hack the cube.... bah.

I got back into the swing of things with my GCN ... a little :) Went for lunch with a buddy of mine and then trekked back to my house for a day of GCN. On our way to my place, we decided to pick up another of our buddies....We played some PoP and Animal Crossing... but mostly we played MK:DD. We were doing fine and they were getting used to the controls so we decided to unlock some things.... Another of my buddies came over which made a cool 4 players and we started to play....We took turns obviously 'cause you can't unlock shit with 3 or more players playing. We beat star cup 150cc and unlocked the bullet train... then special cup 150cc which unlocked the All Cup Tour.... then Allcup tour at 50cc (so boring cause it was too easy)...and you get NOTHING from it...ughhhh... so after 16 tracks in a row... 16 first place finishes... I got tired of the game and we decided to rent one. So another of our buddies came over to make an odd 5.... we rented Super Monkey Ball 2... fun game, but we spent most of the night playing only ONE of the minigames.... target practice or whatever its called... fun fun!... they are telling me to buy that game just for that mionigame.. ughhhh... so thats my progress report for MK:DD!!... and my first rental for GCN. Tomorrow is another day... and we decided to spend it playing video games again... Hunter is the game of choice ... and of course since we have Super Monkey Ball 2 until Sunday.. we will be playing that as well.... and not to forget MK:DD!! ... weeeee... GCN has taken over my weekend! that's all. March 1st Sw0rdfish?.. so far far away?.. :( oh well.

I'm inspired, and when I do... Sometimes something worth reading comes out. So here I go. I'll call it... 10 Things Sw0rdfish Hates About You . Ok well not YOU, but You the Internet... Call it an FAQ if you wish. EDIT: I got interrupted 100 times writing this, who knows how good it turned out. I never re-read my posts before submitting. Sorry if you don't like it... Blame FarCry and my MSN list MSN etiquette Call it They MSN Myth cause frankly there is none. If I'm talking to you, and my doorbell rings, or my Toaster Stroodels start burning, and I'm suddenly gone... That doesn't mean I hate you, it doesn't mean that you're not important... It just means something came up, and I had to go... You don't need a reason, just go! So if I don't apologize for not responding, or if I never message you, don't be offended, I'm probably on my computer to do something else, and MSN is just there. I rarely start a conversation unless I want to bug someone, and I'm sure many other's are like me. TKers, Flamebait, and more TKers are TeamKillers in multiplayer games... They kill their own team. Flamebait are people on message boards who are there to post something that pisses half the users off. They're are the children of the net. Fact is they are there for one reason... To get a rise out of you, and spoil your fun. While you might think this is a huge problem, if you ignore it... It vanishes. If they're killing you, and you say nothing and just keep playing... Chances are they will leave and go find someone who does scream back. Everyone knows this, but no one seems to use this method. Instead we are often treated to an hour of whining for an admin, or moderator to ban the person, and usually you don't find one, and the culprit gets called to bed by his mommy laughing at you. The Net Broke My computer... The Interent did NOT break your computer. Neither did Microsoft. You just don't know what you agreed to when you clicked I agree, or clicked Yes 100 times to get through the install. Visiting Porn sites is NOT healthy for your computer. Neither is Kazaa. If you answered yes to any of the above statements. YOU broke the computer. The internet just built the bulldozer, you're the one who put it in drive. SPAM vs. Chain Letters Arguably one in the same. While that's not necessarily true, one often leads to the other. There is always a monetary reason behind everything that is done in the world. The " Chain Letter " is no different. Every time someone forwards an email, there is one thing that is usually attached to it... 100 other emails. To think each of those persons probably sent the email to on average 10 other people, so no we're at about 1,000. Now some Joe blow gets a hold of this email, runs a script on it, and now has 1,000 email addresses that he can sell to the highest bidder. Highest bidder now sends 1,000 emails explaining how you can get 3 inches in 3 weeks and stay hard for 2 straight nights. This cost highest bidder practically nothing, and as long as he gets a .001% response rate, his costs are covered. This leads me to the chain letter forwardee. [ The person who forwards the email ]. Obviously their intention isn't to get you spammed, but they don't know... And that's the point. So don't yell at them, just ask them to stop, and usually they will... Plus not all emails get back to the jerk who's going to sell them. The BCC, or Blind Carbon Copy, method is picking up, so eventually you wont have the slightest clue who else saw the email, and you can always remove all the other junk from an email before forwarding it on. Hotmail accounts are the best option for these, since you can always stop checking the account when it gets full. If you use the same account for personal and business use, than you're fucked, and it's your fault :D Bill Gates Gave You Money??? No... No he didn't. Microsoft doesn't email you to tell you to delete files, and Walt Disney doesn't care how many times your forward an email... You can't stay in Florida for free. Unfortunately not everyone of these stories can easily be picked out. Use urlLink www.snopes.com to check a story before you email it to 50 people who are going to read it and do the same. Then you have to spend 4 hours resintalling Windows because you destroyed your registry... What's a Registry? Exactly my point. If I called you and told you to cut off a lung because there is a virus going around that attacks lungs, would you do it? Maybe if I was a Doctor... So why do it when your 13 year old nephew tells you to do it through an email to your computer???? USA America News flash, Canada is it's own country. I hate games, sites, and whatever else that wants my Country, or language of preference, or region... And then only put U.S.A, or English [ USA ] What the fuck is wrong with "North America" or adding another line of code that says "Canada". Holy Lazy! I'm not American! No offense to our honoUred, favoUrite, multi-coloUred, neighboUrs to the south Eh? The Internet Geek They exists... I may even be one of them. Mind you I don't dress up to stand in line for a movie, but if I wanted to, who the fuck are you to make fun of me? The world is getting so quick to judge people now a days it's kinda pissing me off. Doesn't matter if someone wants to line up dressed as Yoda, or they want to marry your gay partner... How does that affect you? It doesn't. Your wait is just as long, your wedding will be just as nice, and the movie is still going to be as good [ or shitty ] as it is, the only difference is Yoda and Elton just had that much of a better time, and it didn't hurt anyone. Lay off the bashing, cause frankly it pisses me off. Sites dedicated to the destruction of people who are only out to have a good time??? WTF? Maybe I went off on a tangent on this one, but I'm sure you catch my drift. You don't have to agree with any of that, but it's right... I know... 'cause I wrote it ;) There was more, but frankly I have better things to do then educate the internet on how to act like a human being. Of course the ones reading this probably don't need this stuff to apply to them, cause I know you're all good people, but what the hell... Maybe you'll leave it open at an internet cafe, and the next person who sits down will start reading it. Maybe Google will help me out by throwing a few hits my way. I wrote this without anyone in mind, I don't think I really know anyone who does any of this stuff personally, so don't take offence, I was really just trying to be funny, but make some sort of point. Before I go, I'd like to pass on my sympathies to the world at the loss of a great talented young girl Cecilia Zhang who's body was found today. The world is a worse place to live because of it. You're where no one can hurt you now. Whether you put a C or X in your MSN name, or signed urlLink this , or in your own way showed your feelings of this barbaric, and in-human act. I'm sure you share my feelings. We'll miss you and all who are taken from us way too young. Rest in Peace only the good die young

Word! Well I must apologize once again for a lack of posting activity, but the fact is that nothing too exciting is going on... I do however have to make some comments on the " Bertuzzi Fallout " as urlLink TSN has decided to nickname the incident. Let me give the readers digest version as I see it. Did Bertuzzi intend to hit Moore - Yes Did Bertuzzi intend to hurt Moore - Maybe Did Bertuzzi intend to fracture Moore's Neck, and nearly end his career - Absolutley Not Was Bertuzzi in the right frame of mind when he took the swing - No. 9 - 2 = Frustration, and not being able to defend your captain = more frustration. Did he intend to drive Moore head first into the Ice - Doubtful Does he deserve the suspension for the rest of the season - Yes Does he deserve to play hockey again next year - Yes Basically, I'm getting at the fact that the urlLink NHL can't get carried away and try to "set an example" because when you're frustrated and angry, you don't think about the consequences... You just start swinging. Personally I feel Bertuzzi shouldn't play again until Moore does, so if Moore is out longer than the season, then Bertuzzi should wait as well, but we definitely shouldn't ban him from the game. Let me tell you... The world of urlLink NET and ASP in particular is rather exciting. I know I just make myself sound like the biggest geek in the world, but shit!!! You can do some pretty cool stuff with ASP.NET and C# and I'm having a blast being paid to do it. When I get some time, I'll share my findings. urlLink Microsoft isn't all evil though... Are they? ;o) And Finally... I started editing the Heritage Classic from November of this year... Need to get the sucker down to 4.7GB so I can burn it on to a DVD... Wonder how much time that is?? Peace out!

I am so fucking tired today. I know. I haven't posted in ages. I don't really have anything of value to say usually. Today is no different. The LAN Party was enjoyable, if not a little small. All seemed to be a little sick from the blipping screens and the influx of junk food, pop and pizza. For those of you who have never seen it, and I doubt there is many who read this site, there used to be a crappy video game show on called Video & Arcade Top 10. On this show kids would face off against each other to win a copy of the game they were playing. Horrible production values and hosts who looked like they were just reading cue-cards made the show a waste of television time. However, the host of this show/radio DJ purchased a digital cam from me earlier this week. Only two people in the store recognized him, myself and our software associate (equal in his geek-ness). AS for which one he bought, let me just say its amazing how much "famous" people still want to buy the cheapest product they can get.

Yeah, so seeing randy updated this bitch, i figured i'd write up a blog for ya. Man i haven't blogged in so long, i think the last one on my page is like march 8th or something. It's not even like i'm busy or anything, i come home and sit on my computer doing nothing other than looking at pr0n or watch tv. Hell of a life i lead. So anyway, have you guys been following E3 this year? Well if you haven't all i can say is OH SHIT SON! Nintendo and Sony are pulling out all stops and microsoft is left looking like a bunch of chumps. Sony tried to come in and bite on mintendos handheld market with the PSP. But nintendo came right back and spanked those bastards with the DS. Have you seen this thing...jesus, i don't know what the video game world is going to do when Miyamoto dies. Zelda just looks sick, link is a teenager now so they strayed away from the cel shading and matured it up abit for all you whiners. And if you watched that trailer.....yeah that's real time bitches. Mario tennis looks like it is going to be super fun, they have special attacks now, which look like it will add alot of fun to the game play. Pikmin 2 i only saw a short clip, but it looks like it's based in our world, since they were carrying around bottle caps and oranges. Also looks like you can pla two player and there are new pikmin. And one game that really suprised me and again shows nintendo is the only people thinking up anything new. DK jungle beats! A side scroller where you control your guy with bongo drums! ARE YOU KIDDING ME!!! I'm going to shit my pants. On the other fronts, halo 2 looks sick. Bungie is one of the best developers of all time and it looks like they came through again with this game. Not sure if it's on xbox live or not though...but i will buy an x-box for this game. EA announced they are going xbox live, which will be kinda cool. Even though i don't play sports games that much. PS2 has some alright stuff coming out, i liked the look of Fable although the graphics looked pretty lousy...but whatever they got alot of time to fix that. Damn it i wish i went again this year...stupid job. Anyway, i'll probably blog on my site sometime soon so check it out. Other than that...get ready for halo 2 cause i'm going to rape you all when it comes out.

I am started to get really impressed with the new G4 tackover of techTV. Its a DAILY update from the floor of E3 and all the individual company presentations. They demonstrated the Nintendo DS, the PSP and showed a bunch of the new games from Square/Enix, EA and others. Its like a membership to a game website without paying for it. Watch for it at 10 again tonight and tomorrow.

I can not understand how humans can perpetrate such evil. I agree the Americans were not right in making a one-sided decision to invade Iraq and I understand that many of their tactics are digusting and unethical. I can not however understand how one man can, on live video, in front of many others coldly take the life of an innocent (ie. not promotiong or involved in confilct) man. Having read the article on CNN.com of urlLink Nicholas Berg being beheaded I was about ready to vomit. It is a cowardly act to take an unarmed man's life espescially when he is being held prisoner. It shows no regard for human life and does nothing to eschew the religious views of these groups. It only makes it obvious that they have no faith, believing that any all-mighty power would grant you access to an afterlife after perpetrating such a malicious and destructive act with no concious. If anything, this event only demonstrates their desire for death, destruction and chaos. If this is what humanity is capable of I am disgusted to be a part of it.

I found this on a health message board... and yes I do have problem with drooling in my sleep. The urlLink first post was the question seeking help: ---------------------------------- Posted by Alexa on November 17, 2000 at 00:06:04: My boyfriend has been drooling for a while know, while he sleeps this is getting to be annoying because this is messing up my sheets. It is also annoying to him. Is there anything out there to stop this? What is causing this to happen to him? ---------------------------------- And urlLink here was the useless, yet sadly funny response: ---------------------------------- Posted by chuck on December 15, 2000 at 13:14:36: In Reply to: Drooling while sleeping posted by Alexa on November 17, 2000 at 00:06:04: Get married if you're going to sleep together. Ask any married guy, he'll tell you that marriage solves a lot of fluid loss problems. Here's a clue sweetie: Most men drool, belch, fart, smell bad, whiz on the floor next to the commode, whiz outside anywhere they want, don't wipe as well as women so always have "skid marks" in their briefs/boxers, hog the remote, and will never marry you if they can sleep w/ you w/out any responsibility for the consequences, especially since when you get pregnant he's gone. Note that I said when, not if. ( 99% effective birth control (the pill) means everybody gets pregnant after 100 times; 50% effective birth control (condoms) means there's a 50/50 chance you'll get pregnant every single time you do it and a guaranteed pregnancy on the 51st time). And you're worried about drool? Grow up. By the way, if you find a potential boyfriend who doesn't have most of the bad habits listed above, he probably already has a boyfriend. -------------------------------- I pretty much pissed myself laughing (condoms 50% effective??? 99% means your guaranteed to get pregnant on the hundredth time????) Is the general population getting stupider or do they just want me to think that?
